Export_documentation: The root element of the schema. A container element for one or more datasets. It allows the handling of several different datasets with a single response operation.
documentation: A container element for several datasets.
content:
The root element of the schema. A container element for one or more datasets.

It allows the handling of several different datasets with a single response operation.
full_name: A container element for several datasets.
schema_documentation: TDWG root element: container for one or more DataSets.

Export_documentation: A container element for one to many unit data records and their shared metadata elements. The metadata relate to the source, provision, ownership, and rights etc. of the entire dataset.
documentation: A container element for several unit data records and their shared metadata elements.
abcd3_doc: A concept cohering several unit data records and their shared metadata elements.
content: A container element for one to many unit data records and their shared metadata elements. The metadata relate to the source, provision, ownership, and rights etc. of the entire dataset.
schema_documentation: A dataset containing unit data and their shared metadata elements.

Export_documentation: A globally unique identifier (GUID) for the entire data collection (database, dataset) from which the present dataset was derived (the present dataset may be the result of a query).
documentation: A globally unique identifier for the entire dataset from which the dataset was derived.
abcd3_doc: A globally unique identifier for the entire dataset from which the dataset was derived.
content: A globally unique identifier for the entire data collection (database, dataset) from which the present dataset was derived (the present dataset may be the result of a query). The exact format and/or semantics are still under discussion.
schema_documentation: A globally unique identifier for the entire data collection the present dataset was derived from. The exact format and/or semantics are still under discussion.

Export_documentation: Code or Identifier of the dataset (unique within the institution)
abcd3_doc: Code or Identifier of the dataset (unique within the institution)
schema_documentation: Code or Identifier of the dataset (unique within the institution)

Export_documentation: Container element for the technical contacts responsilbe for the data set.
documentation: A container element for several technical contacts.
content: A container element for several technical contacts.
schema_documentation: Container element for the technical contacts responsilbe for the data set.

Export_documentation: A technical contact normally representing the agent acting as the publisher of the dataset in the network.
documentation: A technical contact normally representing the agent acting as the publisher of the dataset in the network.
abcd3_doc: A concept to bundle contact information.
content:
This is a metadata item normally not used for end-user display and is an element for the GBIF UDDI registry.

Questions and feedback about the availability of a provider or resource should be directed to the technical contact. The technical contact normally represents the agent acting as the publisher of the dataset in the network.
comment: was deprecated in 2.06b, deprecation status removed in 2.06d/e
schema_documentation: A technical contact normally representing the agent acting as the publisher of the dataset in the network.

Export_documentation: A flag set to indicate the preferred technial contact.
example_explanation: The element with its attribute set to true is the preferred contact.
documentation: A flag set to indicate the preferred technial contact.
content: The contact marked as preferred by means of this attribute should be the first approached, the other contacts named should be regarded as alternate contacts.
comment: was deprecated in 2.06b, deprecation status removed in 2.06d/e
recommended:
true, false or empty

For a single unbounded element there should only be one with the @preferred attribute set to true.1
editorial_notes: As a rule, the group of the "recommended" attribute should be set to the same as the corresponding element.
notes_total: As a rule, the group of the "recommended" attribute should be set to the same as the corresponding element.

documentation: Technical contact person, person team, or role name for the dataset.
abcd3_doc: String of the preferred form of personal name for displaying.
content: The name of a technical contact person, person team, or role (e.g. Webmaster) for the dataset.
comment: was deprecated in 2.06b, deprecation status removed in 2.06d/e
schema_documentation: Person, person team, or role name (e. g., 'head of department')

documentation: Email address for the technical contact for the dataset.
abcd3_doc: A valid e-mail address.
content: Email address for the technical contact for the dataset.

schema_documentation: The email address of the agent

documentation: Voice phone number for the technical contact for the dataset.

Export_documentation: Postal address for the technical contact for the dataset.
documentation: An address for the technical contact for the dataset.
abcd3_doc: A string representing an address.
content: An address for the technical contact for the dataset.
comment: was deprecated in 2.06b, deprecation status removed in 2.06d/e

Export_documentation: A container element for several administrative contacts for the dataset.
documentation: A container element for several administrative contacts for the dataset.
content: A container element for several administrative contacts for the dataset.
schema_documentation: Questions and feedback about data, or restrictions on use of the data should be directed here. This contact normally represents the agent acting as the original supplier or custodian of the dataset. If a content contact is given on the unit-level, that one should be used for end-user purposes. The element is unbounded to provide for alternative contacts (vacation etc.).

Export_documentation: An administrative contact usually representing the agent acting as the original supplier or custodian of the dataset.
documentation: An administrative contact usually representing the agent acting as the original supplier or custodian of the dataset.
abcd3_doc: A concept to bundle contact information.
content:
An administrative contact usually representing the agent acting as the original supplier or custodian of the dataset. This is a GBIF UDDI registry element (Administrative-Contact).

Questions and feedback about data, or restrictions on use of the data, should be directed to the administrative contact.

If an administrative contact is given on the unit-level then that one should be used for end-user purposes.
schema_documentation: An administrative contact usually representing the agent acting as the original supplier or custodian of the dataset.

Export_documentation: A flag set to indicate the preferred administrative contact.
example_explanation: The element with its attribute set to true is the preferred contact.
To Do: add the following (former recommended) to documentation or restriction: true, false, or empty. For a single unbounded element there should only be one with the @preferred attribute set to true.
documentation: A flag set to indicate the preferred administrative contact.
content: The contact marked as preferred by means of this attribute should be the first approached. The other contacts named should be regarded as alternate contacts.

Export_documentation: Administrative contact person, person team, or role for the dataset.
documentation: Administrative contact person, person team, or role for the dataset.
abcd3_doc: String of the preferred form of personal name for displaying.
content: The name of the administrative contact person, person team, or role for the dataset (e.g. head of a department).

documentation: Email address for the administrative contact for the dataset.

content: Email address for the administrative contact for the dataset.

documentation: Voice phone number for the administrative contact for the dataset.

Export_documentation: Other known on-line providers of this dataset.
documentation: A container element for several other providers of the datset.
content: A container element for several other providers of the dataset.
schema_documentation: Other known on-line providers of this dataset.

Export_documentation: The UUID (identifier in the UDDI registry) of another data provider known to serve this dataset.
documentation: Another known on-line provider of the dataset.
abcd3_doc: Another known on-line provider of a dataset.
content: Another known on-line provider of the dataset. The UUID (identifier in the UDDI registry) of another data provider known to serve this dataset.
schema_documentation: The UUID (identifier in the UDDI registry) of another data provider known to serve this dataset.

Export_documentation: Metadata referring to the principal source of the entire data collection (the metadata scope may be wider than the objects actually contained in the data set). In its current form, this collection represents a mixture of elements useful for resource discovery (e.g. scope) with metadata actually pertaining to the received (partial) dataset.
documentation: Metadata referring to the received or the source dataset.
content:
The metadata defined here can refer to (i) the source of the entire data collection or (ii) the actual contents of the XML document they are contained in, or (iii) both. In the first case, the metadata scope may be wider than the objects actually contained in the XML document. This can be useful for resource discovery (e.g. scope). Annotations for the individial items will specify the reference point.

If a history of the data collection exists (if it was revised or expanded in various projects or at different institutions), this must be reflected in the IPR statements and perhaps in the list of Owners.
schema_documentation: Metadata referring to the principal source of the entire data collection (the metadata scope may be wider than the objects actually contained in the data set). In its current form, this collection represents a mixture of elements useful for resource discovery (e.g. scope) with metadata actually pertaining to the received (partial) dataset.

Export_documentation: Dublin Core conformant elements describing the content of the data source queried, representation in different languages possible
documentation: Description of the data source queried.
content:
A container for Dublin Core conformant elements describing the content of the data source, from which the present dataset was extracted.

Representation in different languages is possible.
schema_documentation: Dublin Core conformant elements describing the content of the data source queried, representation in different languages possible

Export_documentation: The description in a specified language. Only one representation should be delivered for each language.
documentation: A container for the datasource description in a specified language.
content: This is a container for the datasource description (title, description, etc.) in a specified language. The attribute @language lets you specify the language, the Representation mechanism makes it possible to ensure that only one name per language is specified.
schema_documentation: The description in a specified language. Only one representation should be delivered for each language. [ATTR: language]

Export_documentation: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute, according to RFC 3066.
usage_notes:
The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .
documentation: Language
content: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute. This is a mandatory attribute. The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Export_documentation: A short concise title for the dataset.
example_explanation: The name for the Access System to the Missouri Botanical Garden's VAST (VAScular Tropicos) nomenclatural database and associated authority files.
documentation: A short concise title for the dataset.
abcd3_doc: A short concise title for a concept.
content: A short concise title for the dataset. This is to be used as source for the Dublin-Core standard element "Title", defined as "A name given to the resource" and described as "A name, by which the resource is formally known". See http://dublincore.org/.
editorial_notes:
I did not understand references to Dublin Core that I have come across for numerous elements so I have just copied them as is.

Dublin Core is a metadata standard used to describe documents. It is becoming widely used.
notes_total:
I did not understand references to Dublin Core that I have come across for numerous elements so I have just copied them as is.

Dublin Core is a metadata standard used to describe documents. It is becoming widely used.
schema_documentation:
Source for Dublin-Core standard element "Title": A short, concise title.

General Note on DublinCore translation: In addition to those that can bee transformed from UBIF metadata, an additional DC.Type='dataset' should be added.

Export_documentation: Free-form text containing a longer description of the data source
documentation: Free-form text containing a longer description of the data source.
abcd3_doc: Free-form text containing a longer description of a concept.
content: Free-form text containing a longer description of the dataset's source or content. Source for the Dublin-Core standard element "Description", defined as "an account of the content of the resource", such as an abstract or a free-text account of the content.
schema_documentation: Source for Dublin-Core standard element "Description": Free-form text containing a longer description of the project.

Export_documentation: Free-form text terminology or descriptions available in the data source (geographic, taxonomic, etc.).
documentation: Free-form text terminology or descriptions available in the data source (geographic, taxonomic, etc.).
abcd3_doc: Free-form text terminology or descriptions available in a data source (geographic, taxonomic, etc.).
content: Free-form text describing geographic, taxonomic, or other coverage aspects of terminology or descriptions available in the data source. Source for the Dublin-Core standard element "Coverage", defined as "The extent or scope of the content of the resource". The comment in the ISO standard reads: "Typically, Coverage will include spatial location (a place name or geographic coordinates), temporal period (a period label, date, or date range), or jurisdiction (such as a named administrative entity). Recommended best practice is to select a value from a controlled vocabulary (for example, the Thesaurus of Geographic Names [TGN]) and to use, where appropriate, named places or time periods in preference to numeric identifiers such as sets of coordinates or date range."
schema_documentation: Source for Dublin-Core standard element "Coverage": Free-form text describing geographic, taxonomic, or other coverage aspects of terminology or descriptions available in the current project.

Export_documentation: The URL that points to an online source related to the data source, which may or may not serve as an updated version of the description data.
documentation: URL pointing to an online source related to the data source.
abcd3_doc: URL pointing to an online source describing or being related to the concept.
content: URL that points to an online source related to the data source, which may or may not serve as an updated version of the description data.
schema_documentation: URL pointing to an online source related to the current project, which may or may not serve an updated version of the description data.

Export_documentation: The URL of an icon/logo symbolizing the data source.
documentation: The URL of an icon/logo symbolizing the data source.
abcd3_doc: The URI of an logo/icon.
content: The URI of an icon/logo symbolizing the data source. This is to be used in interfaces to mark contributions of different data sources and/or serve as the link to the appropriate metadata.
schema_documentation: The URI of an icon/logo symbolizing the project.

Export_documentation: Keyword list describing the scope of the data source.
documentation: Keyword list describing the scope of the data source.
abcd3_doc: Keyword list describing the scope of something.
content: Keyword lists of geographical, geo-ecological, geological, and/or taxonomic terms describing the scope of the data source. In the case of projects that are in progress, scope may define the planned or intended, rather than the achieved, scope or coverage. If a scope is given, then the content available should be entirely within the scope, since this item is for resource discovery purposes. Compare also Coverage in DC.Description (which is language-specific). (Items from Scope may be added to DC.Coverage.)
schema_documentation: Keyword lists of geographical, taxonomic, etc. scopes. In the case of projects in progress, 'scope' may define the planned or intended, rather than the achieved scope (or coverage). If scope is given, the content available should be entirely within scope, because this item is for resource discovery purposes. Compare also Coverage in DC.Description (which is language-specific). (Items from Scope may be added to DC.Coverage)

Export_documentation: A collection of terms describing the geoecological scope of the source queried by means of area names.
documentation: A container for geoecological terms describing the data source.
content: A container for geoecological terms describing the data source.
schema_documentation: A collection of terms describing the geoecological scope of the source queried by means of area names (e.g. 'World', 'Germany', 'Atlantic Ocean', 'Andes', 'Mountains'). A list of recommended terms should be developed.

Export_documentation: An area name describing the or part of the geoecological scope of the source queried.
documentation: An area name describing the or part of the geoecological scope of the source queried.
abcd3_doc: An area name describing the or part of the geoecological scope of a queried source.
content: Term describing the - or part of the - geoecological scope of the source queried by means of an area name. A list of recommended terms should be developed.
schema_documentation: An area name describing the or part of the geoecological scope of the source queried.

Export_documentation: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute, according to RFC 3066.
usage_notes:
The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .
documentation: Language
content: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute. This is a mandatory attribute. The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Export_documentation: A container for taxonomic terms describing the data source. This may include scientific and common names of groups of organisms.
documentation: A container for taxonomic terms describing a data source.
content: A container for taxonomic terms describing the data source. This may include scientific and common names of groups of organisms.
schema_documentation: A collection of taxon names of higher rank describing the taxonomic scope of the source queried. A list of recommended terms should be developed.

Export_documentation: A scientific or common taxon name of higher rank, or another term for a group of organisms that serves to describe the - or part of the - taxonomic scope of the source queried. A list of recommended terms should be developed.
To Do: see comment in documentation; recommended terms should be developed
documentation: A name for a group of organisms that is included in the scope of the source queried.
abcd3_doc: A container for taxonomic terms describing a queried source.
content: A scientific or common taxon name of higher rank, or another term for a group of organisms that serves to describe the - or part of the - taxonomic scope of the source queried. A list of recommended terms should be developed.
schema_documentation: A name for a group of organisms that is included in the scope of the source queried.

Export_documentation: The language of the taxonomic term.
usage_notes:
The value LA should be used for scientific names of organism groups formed in accordance with the respective Code of Nomenclature. 

The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .
documentation: Language
content: The language of the term. This is a mandatory attribute. The value LA should be used for scientific names of organism groups formed in accordance with the respective Code of Nomenclature. The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Export_documentation: The number and date of the current version of the data source (particularly for citing purposes).
documentation: The number and date of the current version of the data source.
abcd3_doc: The number and date of the current version of a concept.
content: The number and date of the current version of the data source (particularly for citing purposes).
schema_documentation: Number and date of current version (particularly for citing purposes)

Export_documentation: The major version number of the data source as defined by the content creators.
documentation: The major version number of the data source.
abcd3_doc: A major version number.
content: The major version number of the data source as defined by the content creators (e.g. '1' in 1.2).
schema_documentation: The major version number ('1' in 1.2) as defined by the content creators OR the only version number given.

Export_documentation: An optional minor version number for the data source.
documentation: An optional minor version number for the data source.
abcd3_doc: An optional minor version number.
content: An optional minor version number for the data source (e.g. '2' in 1.2).
schema_documentation: An optional minor version number ('2' in 1.2)

Export_documentation: Unconstrained text specifying a status and an optional number for the data souce version. If this information is missing, release status is assumed.
documentation: Text specifying a status and optional number for the data source version.
abcd3_doc: Text specifying a status and optional number for a version.
content:
Unconstrained text specifying a status and an optional number for the data souce version
(e. g., 'beta', 'alpha', 'rc/release candidate', 'internal'. If this information is missing, release status is assumed.
content_corrected: Unconstrained text specifying a status and an optional number for the data souce version(e. g., 'beta', 'alpha', 'rc/release candidate', 'internal'. If this information is missing, it is assumed to be released.
schema_documentation: Unconstrained text specifying status + optional number, e. g., 'beta', 'alpha', 'rc/release candidate', 'internal'. If missing, release status is assumed.

Export_documentation: Publication date of the current dataset version. This date should be missing if the current version is not yet published
documentation: Publication date of the current dataset version.
abcd3_doc: Concept to describe date and time (and periods).
content: Publication date of the current data source version. Citable 'publication date' of the current version (comp. Revision-Data/ Date-Created and Date-Modified for version-independent dates). This date should be missing if the current version is not yet published.
schema_documentation: Source for Dublin-Core standard element Date.Issued: Citable 'publication date' of the current version (comp. RevisionData/DateCreated and DateModified for version- independent dates). This date should be missing if the current version is not yet published!

Export_documentation: Creators, revision status, and dates of the entire data source from which the current dataset is derived.
documentation: Creators, revision status, and dates of the data source.
content: Creators, revision status, and dates of the entire data source from which the current dataset is derived.
schema_documentation: Creators, Revision status, and dates of the entire data collection from which the current dataset is derived.

Export_documentation: Author(s) or editor(s) of the data source.
documentation: Author(s) or editor(s) of the data collection.
abcd3_doc: Author(s) or editor(s) of a concept.
content: Author(s) or editor(s) of the data source. Source for Dublin-Core standard element "Creator".
schema_documentation: Source for Dublin-Core standard element "Creators", i.e. Author or editor.

Export_documentation: Contributers or translators for the data source.
documentation: Contributers or translators for the data source.
abcd3_doc: Contributers or translators for a concept.
content: Contributers or translators for the data source. Source for Dublin-Core standard element "Contributors".
schema_documentation: Source for Dublin-Core standard element "Contributors": General contributors, or translators.

Export_documentation: Date/time when the data source was created.
documentation: Date/time when the data source was created.
abcd3_doc: Concept to describe date and time (and periods).
content: Source for Dublin-Core element "Date.Created": Date/time when the intellectual content of the data source was produced.
schema_documentation: Source for Dublin-Core standard element "Date.Created": Date/time when the intellectual content (project, term, description, etc.) was created. Applications may initially set this to the system date for new data objects, but authors must be able to change it to an earlier date if necessary. If for legacy data this is imprecisely known, it may be missing here. Earlier versions in other data formats should then be mentioned in the copyright or acknowledgement statements.

Export_documentation: The last modification date for the data source. Source for the Dublin-Core element Date.Modified. If the provider cannot assess this for online data sources, the current date/time may be substituted. For legacy data this may be set to the file date of imported data, or estimated.
documentation: The last modification date for the data source.
abcd3_doc: Concept to describe date and time (and periods).
content: The last modification date for the data source. Source for the Dublin-Core element Date.Modified. If the provider cannot assess this for online data sources, the current date/time may be substituted. For legacy data this may be set to the file date of imported data, or estimated. Note that it may well be that the result of the query, i.e. the document containing this datum, does not contain the parts of the souce that have actually been changed.
notes_total: Note that it may well be that the result of the query, i.e. the document containing this datum, does not contain the parts of the souce that have actually been changed.
schema_documentation: Source for Dublin-Core standard element Date.Modified: Date/time when the last modification of the object was made. If in online data sources the provider can not assess this, the current date/time may be substituted. For legacy data this may be set to the file date of imported data, or estimated. Note that experience shows that the information provided here is often unreliable, because providers tend to disregard updating this information.

Export_documentation: A container element for several owners of the data source.
documentation: A container element for several owners of the data source.
content: A container element for several owners of the data source.
schema_documentation: Entities having legal possession of the data collection content. Here defined for the entire data collection, not for individual units. If an owner statement is present on the unit level, it should override this dataset-level statement.

Export_documentation: An entity having legal possession of the entire data source content. If an owner statement is present on the unit level, it should override this dataset-level statement.
documentation: Legal owner of the source data.
abcd3_doc: A concept to bundle contact information.
content: An entity having legal possession of the entire data source content. If an owner statement is present on the unit level, it should override this dataset-level statement.
schema_documentation: Entity having legal possession of the data collection content.

Export_documentation: Organisation acting as or representing the legal owner of the data source.
documentation: Organisation acting as or representing the legal owner of the data source.
abcd3_doc: Concept to describe an organisation.
content: Organisation acting as or representing the legal owner of the data source.
schema_documentation: Organisation to contact

Export_documentation: The unique reference number GUID (global unique identifier) of the data source owner organisation.
abcd3_doc: The unique reference number GUID (global unique identifier) of an organisation.
comment: documented in the changes for 2.06a (http://wiki.tdwg.org/twiki/bin/view/ABCD/SchemaChangesVersion206) but it was actually in 2.96b
schema_documentation: A globally unique identifier for the organisation or organisational unit

Export_documentation: Container element for several language-specific representations of the full organisation or corporate name for the data source owner.
Export_example: en: 'Botanical Garden of ...', de: 'Botanischer Garten von ...'
documentation: Container element for several language-specific representations of the full organisation or corporate name for the data source owner.
abcd3_doc: Label text in a specific language representing an organisation.
content: Container element for several language-specific representations of the full organisation or corporate name for the data source owner (en: 'Botanical Garden of ...', de: 'Botanischer Garten von ...'). (vCard: Org.Org-Name). The Label mechanism also supports acronyms/abbreviations (no vCard equivalent!).
schema_documentation: Full organization or corporate name in multiple languages (en: 'Botanical Garden of ...', de: 'Botanischer Garten von ...'). (vCard:Org.OrgName). The Label mechanism also supports acronyms / abbreviations (no vCard equivalent!).

Export_documentation: A language-specific label representation of the organisation name of the data collection owner. The attribute @language lets you specify the language, the Representation mechanism makes it possible to ensure that only one name per language is specified.

content: A language-specific label representation of the organisation name of the data collection owner. The attribute @language lets you specify the language, the Representation mechanism makes it possible to ensure that only one name per language is specified.

Export_documentation: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute, according to RFC 3066.
usage_notes:
The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .
documentation: Language representation
content: The language of the element contained in the representation. This is a mandatory attribute. The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.
recommended:
XML type xs:language. According to [http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/], recommended values are defined by the following reference:
H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995.
Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt.

Export_documentation: Label text in a specific language representing the organisation of the legal owner of the data collection.
documentation: Label text in a specific language representing the organisation of the legal owner of the data collection.
abcd3_doc: Label text in a specific language representing the organisation.
content: Label text in a specific language representing the organisation of the legal owner of the data collection.

Export_documentation: Label abbreviation representing the organisation of the legal owner of the data collection. Restricted to 50 characters maximum length, including blanks (shorter recommended!). Label abbreviations are especially important when displaying information in a tabular format.
documentation: Label abbreviation representing the organisation of the legal owner of the data collection.
abcd3_doc: Label abbreviation representing an organisation.
content: Label abbreviation representing the organisation of the legal owner of the data collection. Restricted to 50 characters maximum length, including blanks (shorter recommended!). Label abbreviations are especially important when displaying information in a tabular format.
schema_documentation: Restricted to 50 characters maximum length, including blanks (recommended to be shorter!). Label abbreviations are especially important when displaying information in a tabular format.

Export_documentation: A container element for several organisation units that the collection owner represents or to which the collection owner may belong. (vCard: Org-Unit)
documentation: A container element for several organisation units that the collection owner represents or to which the collection owner may belong.
content: A container element for several organisation units that the collection owner represents or to which the collection owner may belong. (vCard: Org-Unit)
schema_documentation: If the contact contains no person definition: the unit within the organization the agent represents; else a list of the various organisational units to which a person may belong. (vCard:OrgUnit)

Export_documentation: The organisational unit acting as the data source owner or with which the owner is associated. This is compatible with vcard "Org-Unit".
documentation: The organisational unit acting as the data source owner or with which the owner is associated
abcd3_doc: Concept to describe a organisational unit of an organisation.
content: The organisational unit acting as the data source owner or with which the owner is associated. This is compatible with vcard "Org-Unit".
schema_documentation: (vCard:OrgUnit)

Export_documentation: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute, according to RFC 3066.

The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .
documentation: Language
content: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute. This is a mandatory attribute. The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Export_documentation: Person contact representing the owner of the data collection.
documentation: Person contact representing the owner of the data collection.
abcd3_doc: Concept to descibe a Person.
content: Person contact representing the owner of the data collection.
schema_documentation: Person to contact

Export_documentation: The name of person as normally used representing the data collection's legal owner. The name may include titles.
documentation: String of the preferred form of personal name for display representing the data collection's legal owner.
abcd3_doc: String of the preferred form of personal name for displaying.
content: The name of person as normally used representing the data collection's legal owner. The name may include titles.
schema_documentation: Preferred form of personal name for display as a string.

Export_documentation: The full name of the data collection's owner in a form appropriate for sorting alphabetically. The form consists of the following: inherited name (western cultures: lastname) followed by a comma then a space then given names or initials separated by a space (vCard: Sort-String).
example_explanation:
Lastname, Firstname

Lastname, Firstname Middle-Initial
documentation: The full name of the data collection owner in a form appropriate for sorting alphabetically.
abcd3_doc: The full name of a person in a form appropriate for sorting alphabetically.
documentation_corrected: The full name of the data collection owner in an appropriate form for alphabetical sorting.
content:
The full name of the data collection's owner in a form appropriate for sorting alphabetically.

The form consists of the following: inherited name (western cultures: lastname) followed by a comma then a space then given names or initials separated by a space (vCard: Sort-String).
content_corrected: The full name of the data collection's owner in an appropriate form for alphabetical sorting. The form consists of the following: inherited name (western cultures: lastname) followed by a comma then a space then given names or initials separated by a space (vCard: Sort-String).
schema_documentation: The full name with the elements in preferred sorting sequence (vCard: Sort-String).

Export_documentation: Atomized name of the data collection's owner.
documentation: Atomized name of the data collection's owner.
content: Atomized name of the data collection's owner.
schema_documentation: Atomised name of the person.

Export_documentation: The inherited name of the data collection owner. This may consist of family names, generational names, a clan name, parents or grandparents personal names, etc. The inherited name (this being the lastname in western cultures) may be compound (e.g. 'Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture, the inherited name is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to a married couple. Therefore, 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard (vCard: N-Family).
documentation: The inherited name of the data collection owner.
abcd3_doc: The inherited name of a person.
content: The inherited name of the data collection owner. This may consist of family names, generational names, a clan name, parents or grandparents personal names, etc. The inherited name (this being the lastname in western cultures) may be compound (e.g. 'Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture, the inherited name is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to a married couple. Therefore, 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard (vCard: N-Family).
schema_documentation: Family names, generational names, clan name, parents/grandparents personal names, etc. This (= last name in western cultures) may be compound ('Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture it is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to the married couple and children, thus 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard. (vCard:N.Family)

Export_documentation: The prefix to the data collection owner's inherited name. The prefix should be output before the name, but is usually not included in sorting. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard: N-Prefix)
documentation: The prefix to the data collection owner's inherited name.
abcd3_doc: The prefix to a persons inherited name.
content: The prefix to the data collection owner's inherited name. The prefix should be output before the name, but is usually not included in sorting. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard: N-Prefix)
schema_documentation: Prefix to inherited name that should be output before name, but is usually not included in sorting. Examples: 'von', 'Lord'. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard:N.Prefix)

Export_documentation: The suffix for the name of the data collection owner. The suffix should be output after the name, regardless of whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not (vCard: N-Suffix).
documentation: The suffix for the name of the data collection owner.
abcd3_doc: The suffix for the name of a person.
content:
The suffix for the name of the data collection owner. The suffix should be output after the name, regardless of whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not.

Examples: 'Jun.', 'III.'. (vCard: N-Suffix)
schema_documentation: Suffix to name that should be output after name, regardless whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not. Examples: 'Jun.', 'III.'. (vCard:N.Suffix)

Export_documentation: The personal name of the data collection's legal owner. The name given to the person as a personal name (the first or christian name in western cultures, including middle initials). The given name may contain several words. It is applicable only to people (vCard: N-Given + vCard: N-Middle).
documentation: The personal name of the data collection's legal owner, which is the first or christian name in western cultures.
abcd3_doc: The name of a person, which is the first or christian name in western cultures.
content: The personal name of the data collection's legal owner. The name given to the person as a personal name (the first or christian name in western cultures, including middle initials). The given name may contain several words. It is applicable only to people (vCard: N-Given + vCard: N-Middle).
schema_documentation: The name given to a person as a personal name (= first or Christian name in western cultures, including 'middle initials') may contain several words ('Ana Maria', 'Jerry B.'). Applicable only to persons. (vCard:N.Given + vCard:N.Middle)

Export_documentation: The preferred name of the owner of the data collection. The preferred name may differ from the first given name  (vCard: Nickname).
documentation: The preferred name of the owner of the data collection.
abcd3_doc: The preferred name of a person.
content: The preferred name of the owner of the data collection. The preferred name may differ from the first given name (e.g. second given name, nickname ('Bob' for 'Robert'), etc.) (vCard: Nickname).
schema_documentation: May differ from the first given name: second given name, nickname ('Bob' for 'Robert'), etc. (vCard:Nickname)

documentation: A container element for several roles of the owner of the data collection.
content: A container element for several roles of the owner of the data collection.
schema_documentation: A container element for several roles of the person.

Export_documentation: Title for the role of the person or organisation that is the owner of the data collection. This element can be used to provide a title when no individual person is named.
documentation: Title for the role of the person or organisation owner of the data collection.
abcd3_doc: Title for the role of a contact.
content: Title for the role of the person or organisation that is the owner of the data collection. This element can be used to provide a title such as "Database Administrator", "Curator", or "The Director" when no individual person is named. Analogue to vCard: Role : Functional contact name.
schema_documentation: Analogue to vCard:Role: Functional contact name, e.g. "Database administrator", "The Director", etc.

editorial_notes:
Is the group for this element 'container'?

Yes, it is. Indeed, I think we need two subgroups for Container: one for the repeatable elements, and one for the structural containers (like this one). I will further discuss this on the Group page on the wiki.

Export_documentation: A globally unique identifier for the unit (i.e. the physical specimen or original observation).
example_explanation: Sheet number 0012013 in collection 20 (pteridophytes) of the herbarium at the BGBM Berlin-Dahlem (Index Herbariorum Standard Code "B").
To Do: Following DwC, in the absence of a persistent global unique identifier, this should be constructed in the form "URN:catalog:[InstitutionCode]:[CollectionCode]:[CatalogNumber]".
documentation: A globally unique identifier for the unit or the unit record.
abcd3_doc: A globally unique identifier for the unit or the unit record.
content: A globally unique identifier for the unit (i.e. the physical specimen or original observation).
schema_documentation: A globally unique identifier for the unit (i.e. the physical specimen or original observation). Following DwC, in the absence of a persistent global unique identifier, this should be constructed in the form "URN:catalog:[InstitutionCode]:[CollectionCode]:[CatalogNumber]".

Export_documentation: Unique identifier (code or name) of the institution holding the original data source (first part of record identifier). In specimen collections, this is normally the institution or private holder of the collection itself. For herbaria and botanical gardens, the standard abbreviations should be used.
documentation: The unique identifier (code or name) of the institution holding the original data source.
abcd3_doc: The unique identifier (code or name) of the institution holding the original data source.
content:
The unique identifier (code or name) of the institution holding the original data source (the first part of a record identifier). In specimen collections, this is normally the institution or private holder of the collection itself. For herbaria and botanical gardens, the standard abbreviations should be used.

An institutional abbreviation, perhaps with indication of the standard it pertains to (e.g. IH-P for Index Herbariorum and the herbarium at the MNHN in Paris. In practice, this is a controlled vocabulary for many types of collection institutions, but inclusion of private collections must be made possible.

For FAO/IPGRI and EURISCO, the source institution ID is defined as the FAO Institute Code of the institute where the accession is maintained, which consists of the 3-letter ISO 3166 country code of the country where the institute is located plus a three-digit number.

The units within the datasource are not necessarily all owned or administered by this institution.
editorial_notes: Reviewed OK
notes_total: Reviewed OK
schema_documentation: Unique identifier (code or name) of the institution holding the original data source (first part of record identifier). In specimen collections, this is normally the institution or private holder of the collection itself. For herbaria and botanical gardens, the standard abbreviations should be used.

Export_documentation: Name or code of the data source (unique within the institution, second part of the record identifier)
documentation: The name or code of the data source.
abcd3_doc: The name or code of the data source.
content:
The name or code of the data source (this is unique within the institution and constitutes the second part of the record identifier).

The source ID may be the name of a colletion if all records stem from a single collection. Together with the element Source-Institution-Code, Source-Name provides a unique identifier for the dataset's original source.

Existing Standard: ITIS*ca draft metadata.
schema_documentation: Name or code of the data source (unique within the institution, second part of the record identifier)

Export_documentation: A unique identifier for the unit record within the data source. Preferably, the ID should be stable in the database, so that it also can be used to find the same record again (e.g. for data exchange purposes). Third part of the record identifier.
documentation: A unique identifier for the unit record within the data source.
abcd3_doc: A unique identifier for the unit record within the data source.
content:
A unique identifier for the unit record within the data source. The unit ID should provide the key by which a specimen or specimen component can be identified.

Preferrably, the unit ID should be stable in the database, so that it also can be used to find the same record again (e.g. for data exchange purposes). The unit ID constitutes the third part of the globally unique record identifier.

Equivalent to an accession number which is unique inside the collection; if this is the case, the accession number should be entered both here and under AccessionNumber.

In many culture collections, the strain forms the unique identifier and should be entered here (as well as under Strain, AbcdConcept1443).
content_corrected: A unique identifier for the unit record within the data source. The unit ID should provide the key by which a specimen or specimen component can be identified. Preferrably, the unit ID should be stable in the database, so that it can also be used to find the same record again (e.g. for data exchange purposes). The unit ID constitutes the third part of the globally unique record identifier. Equivalent to an accession number which is unique inside the collection; if this is the case, the accession number should be entered both here and under AccessionNumber. In many culture collections, the strain forms the unique identifier and should be entered here (as well as under Strain, AbcdConcept1443).
schema_documentation: A unique identifier for the unit record within the data source. Preferably, the ID should be stable in the database, so that it also can be used to find the same record again (e.g. for data exchange purposes). Third part of the record identifier.

editorial_notes:
So far, for these pages I have been using the term "unit". Should it be "unit record" or something else?

$$Yael$$ Here, we should speak of Unit record; the same is true for the IPR Statements (next item in the schema diagram). I thought I got these things more or less right in the explanations on the unit-level, but found some exeptions (will change in the schema, too):

The following should be "unit record" instead of Unit:
Unit Content Contacts, .. subtypes of the unit (2 cases), Associations, Assemblages

The following should be "unit" instead of Sampling Unit (a term not to be used):
Gathering

The following are correctly termed Unit:
Source Reference, Unit References, Identifications, Kind Of Unit, Multi Media Object, Named Collection Or Surveys, Measurements Or Facts, Sex, Age, Sequences.
notes_total:
So far, for these pages I have been using the term "unit". Should it be "unit record" or something else?

$$Yael$$ Here, we should speak of Unit record; the same is true for the IPR Statements (next item in the schema diagram). I thought I got these things more or less right in the explanations on the unit-level, but found some exeptions (will change in the schema, too):

The following should be "unit record" instead of Unit:
Unit Content Contacts, .. subtypes of the unit (2 cases), Associations, Assemblages

The following should be "unit" instead of Sampling Unit (a term not to be used):
Gathering

The following are correctly termed Unit:
Source Reference, Unit References, Identifications, Kind Of Unit, Multi Media Object, Named Collection Or Surveys, Measurements Or Facts, Sex, Age, Sequences.
schema_documentation: Label text in a specific language.

Export_documentation: The inherited name of the owner of the unit record. This may consist of family names, generational names, a clan name, parents or grandparents personal names, etc. The inherited name (this being the lastname in western cultures) may be compound (e.g. 'Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture, the inherited name is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to a married couple. Therefore, 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard (vCard: N-Family).
documentation: The inherited name of the owner of the unit record, which is the lastname in western cultures.
abcd3_doc: The inherited name of a person.
content: The inherited name of the owner of the unit record. This may consist of family names, generational names, a clan name, parents or grandparents personal names, etc. The inherited name (this being the lastname in western cultures) may be compound (e.g. 'Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture, the inherited name is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to a married couple. Therefore, 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard (vCard: N-Family).
schema_documentation: Family names, generational names, clan name, parents/grandparents personal names, etc. This (= last name in western cultures) may be compound ('Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture it is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to the married couple and children, thus 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard. (vCard:N.Family)

Export_documentation: The prefix to the unit record owner's inherited name. The prefix should be output before the name, but is usually not included in sorting. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard: N-Prefix)
documentation: The prefix to the unit record owner's inherited name.
abcd3_doc: The prefix to a persons inherited name.
content: The prefix to the unit record owner's inherited name. The prefix should be output before the name, but is usually not included in sorting. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard: N-Prefix)
full_name: Unit record owner's inherited name prefix
schema_documentation: Prefix to inherited name that should be output before name, but is usually not included in sorting. Examples: 'von', 'Lord'. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard:N.Prefix)

Export_documentation: The suffix for the name of the owner of the unit record. The suffix should be output after the name, regardless of whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not. (vCard: N-Suffix)
documentation: The suffix for the name of the owner of the unit record.
abcd3_doc: The suffix for the name of a person.
content:
The suffix for the name of the owner of the unit record. The suffix should be output after the name, regardless of whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not.

Examples: 'Jun.', 'III.'. (vCard: N-Suffix)
schema_documentation: Suffix to name that should be output after name, regardless whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not. Examples: 'Jun.', 'III.'. (vCard:N.Suffix)

Export_documentation: The personal name of the legal owner of the unit record. The name given to the person as a personal name (the first or christian name in western cultures, including middle initials). The given name may contain several words. It is applicable only to people (vCard: N-Given + vCard: N-Middle).
documentation: The personal name of the legal owner of the unit record, which is the first or christian name in western cultures.
abcd3_doc: The name of a person, which is the first or christian name in western cultures.
content: The personal name of the legal owner of the unit record. The name given to the person as a personal name (the first or christian name in western cultures, including middle initials). The given name may contain several words. It is applicable only to people (vCard: N-Given + vCard: N-Middle).
schema_documentation: The name given to a person as a personal name (= first or Christian name in western cultures, including 'middle initials') may contain several words ('Ana Maria', 'Jerry B.'). Applicable only to persons. (vCard:N.Given + vCard:N.Middle)

Export_documentation: The preferred name of the owner of the unit record. The preferred name may differ from the first given name (vCard: Nickname).
documentation: The preferred name of the owner of the unit record.
abcd3_doc: The preferred name of a person.
content: The preferred name of the owner of the unit record. The preferred name may differ from the first given name (e.g. second given name, nickname ('Bob' for 'Robert'), etc.) (vCard: Nickname).
schema_documentation: May differ from the first given name: second given name, nickname ('Bob' for 'Robert'), etc. (vCard:Nickname)

content: A container element for several roles of the unit owner.
schema_documentation: A container element for several roles of the person.

Export_documentation: Title for the role of the person or organisation that is the owner of the unit record. This element can be used to provide a title when no individual person is named.
To Do: vCard: Role : Functional contact name (e.g. "Database administrator", "The Director", etc.).
documentation: Title for the role of the person or organisation owner of the unit record.
abcd3_doc: Title for the role of a contact.
content:
Title for the role of the person or organisation that is the owner of the unit record. This element can be used to provide a title such as "Database Administrator" or "Curator" when no individual person is named.

Analogue to vCard: Role : Functional contact name (e.g. "Database administrator", "The Director", etc.).
schema_documentation: Analogue to vCard:Role: Functional contact name, e.g. "Database administrator", "The Director", etc.

Questions and feedback about data, or restrictions on use of the data contained in the unit record should be directed to the contact given here.

If present, this contact overrides a content contact on the level of the dataset.

Questions and feedback about data, or restrictions on use of the data contained in the unit record should be directed to the contact given here.

If present, this contact overrides a content contact on the level of the dataset.

The name may include titles.

Export_documentation:
The full name of the administrative contact for the unit record in a form appropriate for sorting alphabetically.

The form consists of the following: Family name first followed by a comma then a space then given names or initials separated by a space.
example_explanation:
Lastname, Firstname

Lastname, Firstname Middle-Initial
documentation: The full name of the administrative contact for the unit record in a form appropriate for sorting alphabetically. (vCard: Sort-String)
abcd3_doc: The full name of a person in a form appropriate for sorting alphabetically.

The full name of the administrative contact for the unit record in a form appropriate for sorting alphabetically.

The form consists of the following: Family name first followed by a comma then a space then given names or initials separated by a space.
content_corrected: The full name of the administrative contact for the unit record in an appropriate form for alphabetical sorting. The form consists of the following: Family name first followed by a comma then a space then given names or initials separated by a space.

schema_documentation: The full name with the elements in preferred sorting sequence (vCard: Sort-String).

Export_documentation: The inherited name of the administrative contact for the unit record. This may consist of family names, generational names, a clan name, parents or grandparents personal names, etc. The inherited name (this being the lastname in western cultures) may be compound (e.g. 'Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture, the inherited name is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to a married couple. Therefore, 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard (vCard: N-Family).
documentation: The inherited name of the administrative contact for the unit record, which is the lastname in western cultures.
abcd3_doc: The inherited name of a person.
content: The inherited name of the administrative contact for the unit record. This may consist of family names, generational names, a clan name, parents or grandparents personal names, etc. The inherited name (this being the lastname in western cultures) may be compound (e.g. 'Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture, the inherited name is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to a married couple. Therefore, 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard (vCard: N-Family).
subgroup: Unit record administrative contact's inherited name
schema_documentation: Family names, generational names, clan name, parents/grandparents personal names, etc. This (= last name in western cultures) may be compound ('Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture it is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to the married couple and children, thus 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard. (vCard:N.Family)

Export_documentation: The prefix to the unit record administrative contact's inherited name. The prefix should be output before the name, but is usually not included in sorting. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard: N-Prefix)
documentation: The prefix to the unit record administrative contact's inherited name.
abcd3_doc: The prefix to a persons inherited name.
content: The prefix to the unit record administrative contact's inherited name. The prefix should be output before the name, but is usually not included in sorting. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard: N-Prefix)
full_name: Unit record administrative contact's inherited name prefix
schema_documentation: Prefix to inherited name that should be output before name, but is usually not included in sorting. Examples: 'von', 'Lord'. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard:N.Prefix)

Export_documentation:
The suffix for the name of the administrative contact for the unit record. The suffix should be output after the name, regardless of whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not.

Examples: 'Jun.', 'III.'. (vCard: N-Suffix)
documentation: The suffix for the name of the administrative contact for the unit record.
abcd3_doc: The suffix for the name of a person.
content:
The suffix for the name of the administrative contact for the unit record. The suffix should be output after the name, regardless of whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not.

Examples: 'Jun.', 'III.'. (vCard: N-Suffix)
full_name: Unit record administrative contact's name suffix
schema_documentation: Suffix to name that should be output after name, regardless whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not. Examples: 'Jun.', 'III.'. (vCard:N.Suffix)

Export_documentation: The personal name of the administrative contact for the unit record. The name given to the person as a personal name (the first or christian name in western cultures, including middle initials). The given name may contain several words. It is applicable only to people (vCard: N-Given + vCard: N-Middle).
documentation: The personal name of the administrative contact for the unit record, which is the first or christian name in western cultures.
abcd3_doc: The name of a person, which is the first or christian name in western cultures.
content: The personal name of the administrative contact for the unit record. The name given to the person as a personal name (the first or christian name in western cultures, including middle initials). The given name may contain several words. It is applicable only to people (vCard: N-Given + vCard: N-Middle).
full_name: Unit record administrative contact's given name
schema_documentation: The name given to a person as a personal name (= first or Christian name in western cultures, including 'middle initials') may contain several words ('Ana Maria', 'Jerry B.'). Applicable only to persons. (vCard:N.Given + vCard:N.Middle)

usage_notes:
The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .
documentation: Language
content: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute. This is a mandatory attribute. The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Export_documentation: Assignation of a scientific or vernacular name or material classification to the unit. In cases where more than one name applies to a single unit, several identifications should be formed and flagged as preferred. Relationships between differently identified sub-units of the unit can be specified by means of the Identification-Role.

abcd3_doc: Assignation of a scientific or vernacular name to a unit.
content: Assignation of a scientific or vernacular name or material classification to the unit. In cases where more than one name applies to a single unit, several identifications should be formed and flagged as preferred. Relationships between differently identified sub-units of the unit can be specified by means of the Identification-Role.

Export_documentation: A container element for several designations of higher taxa used by the data source to classify the taxon name assigned to the unit in the identification event.
documentation: A container element for several designations of higher taxa used by the data source to classify the taxon name assigned to the unit in the identification event.
content: A container element for several designations of higher taxa used by the data source to classify the taxon name assigned to the unit in the identification event. Note that if a higher taxon such as a family name is the result of the identification itself, it should (also) be noted under Full-Scientific-Name-String (mandatory) and Genus-Or-Monomial (optional).
editorial_notes: $$Yael$$ English?
notes_total: $$Yael$$ English?; Note that if a higher taxon such as a family name is the result of the identification itself, it should (also) be noted under Full-Scientific-Name-String (mandatory) and Genus-Or-Monomial (optional).
schema_documentation: Wrapper element for multiple designations of higher taxa. These are higher-level classifications of the name identified, NOT a higher taxon as the sole identification.

Export_documentation: The scientific name and rank of a taxon with a rank higher than Genus that is used by the data source to classify the taxon name assigned to the unit in the identification event. Although this is not really within the scope of ABCD's data domain, this item is kept for compatibility reasons (Darwin Core) and because for the time being searches are often executed using this item (although classification may vary considerably in source datasets). Eventually, we hope that this function will largely be replaced by taxon and name services defined and provided elsewhere. It is highly recommended to make use of the rank element, because this is a prerequisit for data transformation to Darwin Core.
To Do: DwC? Should the element be eliminated? If not the description needs to be revised.
documentation: A container for the designation of a higher taxon used by the data source to classify the taxon name assigned to the unit in the identification event.
abcd3_doc: A container for the designation of a higher taxon used by the data source to classify the taxon name assigned to the unit in the identification event.
content: The scientific name and rank of a taxon with a rank higher than Genus that is used by the data source to classify the taxon name assigned to the unit in the identification event. Note that if a higher taxon such as a family name is the result of the identification itself, it should (also) be noted under Full-Scientific-Name-String (mandatory) and Genus-Or-Monomial (optional). Although this is not really within the scope of ABCD's data domain, this item is kept for compatibility reasons (Darwin Core) and because for the time being searches are often executed using this item (although classification may vary considerably in source datasets). Eventually, we hope that this function will largely be replaced by taxon and name services defined and provided elsewhere. It is highly recommended to make use of the rank element, because this is a prerequisit for data transformation to Darwin Core.
notes_total: Note that if a higher taxon such as a family name is the result of the identification itself, it should (also) be noted under Full-Scientific-Name-String (mandatory) and Genus-Or-Monomial (optional).
schema_documentation: The scientific name of a taxon with a rank higher than Genus which is commonly used to classify the group the unit belongs to.

Export_documentation: A generic or higher taxon name (monomial) in accordance with rules of nomenclature and associated with the identified taxon. This is not necessarily the result of the identification event, but a classification added to the result of the identification in the source database.
documentation: A higher taxon name associated with the identified taxon.
abcd3_doc: A higher taxon name associated with the identified taxon.
content: A generic or higher taxon name (monomial) in accordance with rules of nomenclature and associated with the identified taxon. This is not necessarily the result of the identification event, but a classification added to the result of the identification in the source database. Note that if a higher taxon such as a family name is the result of the identification itself, it should (also) be noted under Full-Scientific-Name-String (mandatory) and Genus-Or-Monomial (optional).
notes_total: Note that if a higher taxon such as a family name is the result of the identification itself, it should (also) be noted under Full-Scientific-Name-String (mandatory) and Genus-Or-Monomial (optional).
schema_documentation: A higher taxon name.

Export_documentation:
The rank designation of the associated higher taxon (above the rank of genus). The fully spelled out rank value (in latin but for the "unranked" term and the "group" levels). This can be used as metadata for any name for a taxon of rank above the genus-level.
It is strongly recommended to use this element, since a rank value is required in order to transform ABCD data for higher taxa to Darwin Core.
documentation: Rank of associated higher taxon.
abcd3_doc: Rank of associated higher taxon.
content:
The rank designation of the associated higher taxon (above the rank of genus). The fully spelled out rank value (in latin but for the "unranked" term and the "group" levels). This can be used as metadata for any name for a taxon of rank above the genus-level.
It is strongly recommended to use this element, since a rank value is required in order to transform ABCD data for higher taxa to Darwin Core. Please note that this is not the abbreviation for a rank that is used in a botanical infraspecific name, as it appears in the name.
notes_total: Note that this is not the abbreviation for a rank that is used in a botanical infraspecific name, as it appears in the name.
schema_documentation: Rank of associated higher taxon.
restriction: regnum, subregnum, superphylum, phylum, subphylum, superclassis, classis, subclassis, superordo, ordo, subordo, superfamilia, familia, subfamilia, tribus, genusgroup, unranked
restriction_detail: ( enumeration=( regnum, subregnum, superphylum, phylum, subphylum, superclassis, classis, subclassis, superordo, ordo, subordo, superfamilia, familia, subfamilia, tribus, genusgroup, unranked, ))

Export_documentation: The name of the taxon identified in the unit identification, formed according to the different Codes of Nomenclature which apply to scientific names (with additional elements for suffixes or other expressions commonly used in taxonomic identifications).
documentation: The name of the taxon identified in the unit identification, formed according to the different Codes of Nomenclature which apply to scientific names.
abcd3_doc: The name of an identified taxon. Formed according to the different Codes of Nomenclature which apply to scientific names.
documentation_corrected: The name of the taxon identified in the unit identification and formed accordingly to the different Codes of Nomenclature which apply to scientific names.
content: The name of the taxon identified in the unit identification, formed according to the different Codes of Nomenclature which apply to scientific names (with additional elements for suffixes or other expressions commonly used in taxonomic identifications).

schema_documentation: Name of the taxon identified, formed according to the different Codes of Nomenclature which apply to scientific names - with additional elements for suffixes or other expressions commonly used in taxonomic identifications.

Export_documentation: A concatenated scientific name given as the result of the unit identification, preferrably formed in accordance with a Code of Nomenclature as fully as possible (i. e. a monomial, bionomial, or trinomial plus author[s] or author team[s] and - where relevant - year, or the full name of a cultivar or cultivar group, or a hybrid formula or named hybrid).
documentation: A concatenated scientific name formed in the unit identification.
abcd3_doc: A concatenated scientific name formed in the unit identification.
content: A concatenated scientific name given as the result of the unit identification, preferrably formed in accordance with a Code of Nomenclature as fully as possible (i. e. a monomial, bionomial, or trinomial plus author[s] or author team[s] and - where relevant - year, or the full name of a cultivar or cultivar group, or a hybrid formula or named hybrid).
full_name: Full scientific name identified for unit
schema_documentation: Concatenated scientific name, preferably formed in accordance with a Code of Nomenclature, i. e. a monomial, binomial, or trinomial plus author(s) or author team(s) and - where relevant - year, or the name of a cultivar or cultivar group, or a hybrid formula, as fully as possible.

Export_documentation:
Atomised data items of the taxon identified for the unit, with subtypes according to the different Codes of Nomenclature which apply to scientific names.

Mandatory (at least one) for unit identifications.
documentation: Atomised data items of the taxon identified for the unit.
content:
Atomised data items of the taxon identified for the unit, with subtypes according to the different Codes of Nomenclature which apply to scientific names.

Mandatory (at least one) for unit identifications, but optional in other contexts (e.g. synecology).

notes_total: Error: The fullname listed in the schema for this element is 'higher taxa', - corrected

documentation: Atomised botanical name formed in the unit identification, with elements according to the International Code of Botanical Nomenclature.
abcd3_doc: Atomised botanical name formed in the unit identification, with elements according to the International Code of Botanical Nomenclature.

Export_documentation:
One of the following, representing the genus, or higher taxon name, identified for the unit:

A generic name as a botanical scientific name or as part of it

A manuscript name

An intergeneric hybrid name under the ICBN, without the leading multiplication sign

The name of an intergeneric graft hybrid or graft chimaera, published under the Cultivated Code.

Rules: First letter capitalised; No spaces included.
documentation: The genus as part or only result of an identification, or a higher taxon name representing that result.
abcd3_doc: The genus as part or only result of an identification, or a higher taxon name representing that result.
content:
One of the following, representing the genus, or higher taxon name, identified for the unit:

A generic name as a botancal scientific name or as part of it

A manuscript name

An intergeneric hybrid name under the ICBN, without the leading multiplication sign

The name of an intergeneric graft hybrid or graft chimaera, published under the Cultivated Code.

Note that the classification of the identification result (e.g. the family of the species identified) is accommodated by the elements under HigherTaxa.

Rules: First letter capitalised; No spaces included.
content_corrected: One of the following, representing the genus, or higher taxon name, identified for the unit: A generic name as a botanical scientific name or as part of it. A manuscript name, an intergeneric hybrid name under the ICBN, without the leading multiplication sign. The name of an intergeneric graft hybrid or graft chimaera, published under the Cultivated Code. Note that the classification of the identification result (e.g. the family of the species identified) is accommodated by the elements under HigherTaxa. Rules: First letter capitalised; No spaces included.
full_name: Genus or monomial identified for the unit
editorial_notes: Generic names are essentially the same under the different codes; however, to avoid having to place the essential parts of a name on different levels of the hierarchy, all name elements recognized under a specific code are listed in the respective section.; Note that the classification of the identification result (e.g. the family of the species identified) is accommodated by the elements under HigherTaxa.
notes_total: Generic names are essentially the same under the different codes; however, to avoid having to place the essential parts of a name on different levels of the hierarchy, all name elements recognized under a specific code are listed in the respective section.
schema_documentation: Genus or higher taxon name.

Export_documentation:
The first epithet in a botanical name combination that was identified for the unit (i.e. the epithet of a genus subdivision or a species epithet).

The specific epithet portion of the scientific name, in latin, in lowercase letters. The abbreviation "sp." is allowed.
A
Rules:

1 No uppercase

2. No space

The first epithet in a botanical name combination that was identified for the unit (i.e. the epithet of a genus subdivision or a species epithet).
