Export_documentation:
The final epithet of a botanical name of infraspecific rank identified for the unit.

The infraspecific epithet (i.e. the epithet following the indication of the infraspecific rank in the name string (trinomial)).

Subtaxa can be used to store any additional taxonomic identifier, in latin. Following abbreviations are allowed: "subsp." (for subspecies); "convar." (for convariety); "var." (for variety); "f." (for form).

Rules:

1 No uppercase

2. No space
documentation: The final epithet of a botanical name of infraspecific rank identified for the unit.
abcd3_doc: The final epithet of a botanical name of infraspecific rank identified for the unit.
content:
The final epithet of a botanical name of infraspecific rank identified for the unit.

The infraspecific epithet (i.e. the epithet following the indication of the infraspecific rank in the name string (trinomial)).

Subtaxa can be used to store any additional taxonomic identifier, in latin. Following abbreviations are allowed: "subsp." (for subspecies); "convar." (for convariety); "var." (for variety); "f." (for form). A FAO/IPGRI multi-crop passport descriptor (MCPD), description and examples taken from EURISCO descriptor list dated July 3, 2002.

Note that quadrinomials etc. are not supported here as names; if deemed necessary, they can be entered in the FullScientificNameString, this element should than contain the last infraspecific epithet.

Rules:

1 No uppercase

2. No space

Export_documentation: A flag indicating that the unit identified is a named hybrid ("x") or a graft chimaera ("+").
documentation: A flag indicating that the unit identified is a named hybrid or a graft chimaera.
abcd3_doc: A flag indicating that the unit identified is a named hybrid or a graft chimaera.
content:
A flag indicating that the unit identified is a named hybrid or a graft chimaera.

The attribute @insertionpoint defines if this applies to the generic, species, or infraspecific level.
schema_documentation: Flag indicating that this is a named hybrid ("x") or a graft chimaera ("+"). The attribute insertionpoint defines the name element in front of which the qualifier should be inserted (1 = before entire name, 2= before first epithet, 3 = before rank designation for second epithet.)

Export_documentation: This attribute specifies the name element in front of which the hybrid flag should be inserted (1 = before entire name, 2= before first epithet, 3 = before rank designation for second epithet.)

Export_documentation:
Author team of the basionym of a combination identfied for the unit.

If the second epithet is empty, this is the authority for the species name. Otherwise this is the subtaxa authority at the most detailed taxonomic level (e.g.(Waldst. et Kit.) Arc.

Author(s) of the original name for a taxon which has subsequently been revised but retains the same stem or epithet. May be preceded by a sanctioning author. If possible, preceding "ex" authors should be avoided.

Note that the classification of the identification result (e.g. the family of a species identified) should be listed under HigherTaxon.

Generic names are essentially the same under the different codes; however, to avoid having to place the essential parts of a name on different levels of the hierarchy, all name elements recognized under a specific code are listed in the respective section.

Export_documentation: The attribute @insertionpoint defines the name element in the scientific name identified for the unit before which the identification qualifier should be inserted (1 = before entire name, 2 =  before first epithet, 3 = before second epithet).
example_explanation: If the attribute @Insertion-Point is set to 1 the qualifer is to be inserted before the entire name.

Export_documentation: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute, according to RFC 3066.
usage_notes:
The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .
documentation: Language
content: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute. This is a mandatory attribute. The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

The form consists of the following: Family name first followed by a comma then a space then given names or initials separated by a space.

Lastname, Firstname

Lastname, Firstname Middle-Initial

Export_documentation: The inherited name of the unit identifier. This may consist of family names, generational names, a clan name, parents or grandparents personal names, etc. The inherited name (this being the lastname in western cultures) may be compound (e.g. 'Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture, the inherited name is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to a married couple. Therefore, 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard (vCard: N-Family).
documentation: The inherited name of the unit identifier, which is the lastname in western cultures.
abcd3_doc: The inherited name of a person.
content: The inherited name of the unit identifier. This may consist of family names, generational names, a clan name, parents or grandparents personal names, etc. The inherited name (this being the lastname in western cultures) may be compound (e.g. 'Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture, the inherited name is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to a married couple. Therefore, 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard (vCard: N-Family).
comment: wrongly documented in the TDWG Wiki and the Access Database as '/DataSets/DataSet/Units/Unit/Identifications/Identification/Identifiers/Identifier/IdentifierPersonName/AtomisedName/InheritedName'
schema_documentation: Family names, generational names, clan name, parents/grandparents personal names, etc. This (= last name in western cultures) may be compound ('Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture it is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to the married couple and children, thus 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard. (vCard:N.Family)

Export_documentation:
The suffix for the name of the unit identifier. The suffix should be output after the name, regardless of whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not.

Examples: 'Jun.', 'III.'. (vCard: N-Suffix)

Export_documentation:
A (bibliographic) reference which has provided the unit identification (and - if present - the identifier's name and/or organisation). The entire identification event was taken from the source given here.

It is not recommended to cite "field tag", or "determination slip" here as the source of the identification but to restrict this to published works. However, it is recommended to record the reference also when the specimen's identity is simply listed in the material examined section.
abcd3_doc: A concept to describe a reference or citation.
content:
A (bibliographic) reference which has provided the unit identification (and - if present - the identifier's name and/or organisation). The entire identification event was taken from the source given here.

It is not recommended to cite "field tag", or "determination slip" here as the source of the identification but to restrict this to published works. However, it is recommended to record the reference also when the specimen's identity is simply listed in the material examined section.

Note that this is not the literature (e.g. key) used to obtain the identification result (see IdentificationReferences).
content_corrected: A (bibliographic) reference which has provided the unit identification (and - if present - the identifier's name and/or organisation). The entire identification event was taken from the source given here. It is not recommended to cite "field tag", or "determination slip" here as the source of the identification but to restrict this to published works. However, it is recommended to record the reference, also when the specimen's identity is simply listed in the material examined section. Note that this is not the literature (e.g. key) used to obtain the identification result (see IdentificationReferences).
notes_total: Note that this is not the literature (e.g. key) used to obtain the identification result (see IdentificationReferences).
schema_documentation: A reference which has provided the identification (and - if present - the identifier's name and/or organisation). The entire identification event was taken from the literature or comparable source given here. Note that this is not the literature (e.g. key) used to obtain the result (see IdentificationReferences).

A container element for references that were used by the identifier to provide the identification (e.g. by means of providing a key or a description of the taxon). It circumscribes the taxon identified (and thus can act as a potential taxon's sec. reference).

Export_documentation:
The date of the unit identification event. Identification dates are commonly incompletely known (e.g. only the year or year and month) or unknown. Sometimes identification dates are inferred from a researcher's visit or the duration of a loan.

The rather complex ABCD {{{DateTime}}} type is used, although many of its elements are not normally needed. As a rule, only the {{{IsoDateTimeBegin}}} element is mapped, which is the one used for searches and which can be used to construct identification histories. Alternatively, the {{{DateText}}} element can also be used, but it provides only for human readability.

However, the elements for exact time and periods may be useful for time series in laboratory reports that can be formulated as a series of identification events, or where the result of the identification may be influenced by the duration of a detection process.
To Do: short version? links to other concepts
documentation: The date of the unit identification event.
abcd3_doc: Concept to describe date and time (and periods).
content:
The date of the unit identification event. Identification dates are commonly incompletely known (e.g. only the year or year and month) or unknown. Sometimes identification dates are inferred from a researcher's visit or the duration of a loan.

The rather complex ABCD {{{DateTime}}} type is used, although many of its elements are not normally needed. As a rule, only the {{{IsoDateTimeBegin}}} element is mapped, which is the one used for searches and which can be used to construct identification histories. Alternatively, the {{{DateText}}} element can also be used, but it provides only for human readability.

However, the elements for exact time and periods may be useful for time series in laboratory reports that can be formulated as a series of identification events, or where the result of the identification may be influenced by the duration of a detection process.
schema_documentation: Date of the identification event.

Export_documentation:
A text version (alphabetic mixed case and integer) of the date at which the unit identification event took place. This element is meant for use when the date is imprecise, ambiguous or not in a form that satisfies the standard structured date format. It can also be used when it is important to record the verbatim representation of the date or when dates to be recorded are not completely legible. For example the day and month may be decipherable but not the year; the use of this field will allow recording of partially interpreted information.

This field can be used to record generalised date ranges and irresolvable ambiguity such as different day/month order conventions (e.g. US/Europe) or to allow for multiple dates and periods.
Export_example:
25 [?] 1925

3/9/45 [ambiguous day month]

Spring 1912

Late 1800s

End of 19th Century

Mid 1978

Easter 1933

Post WW2

Before June 25, 2000

After June 25, 2000
documentation: The date of the unit identification event in text format.
abcd3_doc: A date in text format.
content:
A text version (alphabetic mixed case and integer) of the date at which the unit identification event took place. This element is meant for use when the date is imprecise, ambiguous or not in a form that satisfies the standard structured date format. It can also be used when it is important to record the verbatim representation of the date or when dates to be recorded are not completely legible. For example the day and month may be decipherable but not the year; the use of this field will allow recording of partially interpreted information.

This field can be used to record generalised date ranges and irresolvable ambiguity such as different day/month order conventions (e.g. US/Europe) or to allow for multiple dates and periods.

Note that this element is not normally used for searches.
example_value:
25 [?] 1925

3/9/45 [ambiguous day month]

Spring 1912

Late 1800s

End of 19th Century

Mid 1978

Easter 1933

Post WW2

Before June 25, 2000

After June 25, 2000
notes_total: Note that this element is not normally used for searches.
schema_documentation: The date in text format

Export_documentation:
The time zone to which the time-of-day data for the unit identification event refer.

Timezone expressed in minutes in accordance with the "seven property model" for date/time attributes in XML schema (http://www.w3.org/TR/2004/WD-xmlschema11-2-20040716/#theSevenPropertyModel).

An integer between -840 and 840 inclusive (+/- 14 hours).
example_explanation:
UTM + 9 hours 30 minutes (Australia Central Standard)

UTM - 5 hours (Eastern Standard Time)
content:
The time zone to which the time-of-day data for the unit identification event refer.

Timezone expressed in minutes in accordance with the "seven property model" for date/time attributes in XML schema (http://www.w3.org/TR/2004/WD-xmlschema11-2-20040716/#theSevenPropertyModel).
notes_total:
Note that this element is not normally used for identifications.

The time zone to which the time-of-day data for the unit identification event refer.
schema_documentation: The time zone to which the time-of-day data refer

Export_documentation: The exact date (and time) or beginning of a period representing the unit identification event, expressed in a modified ISO/ANSI 8601 standard structured date format.
usage_notes: The date format looks like this: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS with flexible precision.
documentation: The beginning of the unit identification period, or exact date, expressed in a modified ISO/ANSI structured format.
abcd3_doc: The point in time of the beginning of a period expressed in a modified ISO/ANSI structured format.
content:
The exact date (and time) or beginning of a period representing the unit identification event, expressed in a modified ISO/ANSI 8601 standard structured date format.

Note that this is the most commonly used element here. If it is impossible to map (because the db values are not in an ISO string format or the internal db date datatype), one has to use the {{{DateText}}} element (AbcdConcept0383).
notes_total: Note that this is the most commonly used element here. If it is impossible to map (because the db values are not in an ISO string format or the internal db date datatype), one has to use the {{{DateText}}} element (AbcdConcept0383).
schema_documentation: The exact date (and time) or beginning of a period, expressed in a modified ISO/ANSI 8601 standard structured format

Export_documentation:
The Julian day number (or sequential day) in the year for the exact date or for the beginning day of a period representing the unit identification event. The year is given in ISO-Date-Time-Begin.

The content range is 1-365 for normal years, 366 for leap years.
documentation: The Julian day number in the year for the beginning of the unit identification event period.
abcd3_doc: The Julian day number in the year for the beginning of a period.
content:
Note that this element is not normally used for identifications.

The Julian day number (or sequential day) in the year for the exact date or for the beginning day of a period representing the unit identification event. The year is given in ISO-Date-Time-Begin.

The content range is 1-365 for normal years, 366 for leap years.
full_name: Start of unit identification (Julian day number)
notes_total: Note that this element is not normally used for identifications.
schema_documentation: Julian day number in the year for the exact date or for the beginning day of a period

Export_documentation:
Time of day in decimal hours from midnight local time for an exact point in time or for the beginning of a time period representing the unit identification event.

This field may apply to times of collecting where this is considered important.

Note that times are decimial hours: 13.5 represents 1:30 pm, not 1:05 pm, nor 1:50 pm.

Time can also be expressed in the ISO {{{DateTimeElement}}}.
documentation: The time of day in hours from midnight local time for the beginning of the unit identification event.
abcd3_doc: The time of day in hours from midnight local time for the beginning of a period.
content:
Note that this element is not normally used in the context of an identification event.

Time of day in decimal hours from midnight local time for an exact point in time or for the beginning of a time period representing the unit identification event.

This field may apply to times of collecting where this is considered important.

Note that times are decimial hours: 13.5 represents 1:30 pm, not 1:05 pm, nor 1:50 pm.

Time can also be expressed in the ISO {{{DateTimeElement}}}.
full_name: Start of unit identification (time of day)
notes_total: Note that this element is not normally used in the context of an identification event.
schema_documentation: Time of day in hours from midnight for an exact point in time or for the beginning of a time period. This is also covered by ISODateTimeBegin, except in cases when the date is not known

Export_documentation: The end of the unit identification event expressed in a modified ISO/ANSI 8601 standard structured date format.
usage_notes: The date format looks like this: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS with flexible precision.
documentation:
The end of the unit identification event expressed in a modified ISO/ANSI 8601 standard structured date format.

Note that this element is rarely used in the context of an identification event.
abcd3_doc: The end of a period expressed in a modified ISO/ANSI 8601 standard structured date format.
content: The end of the unit identification event expressed in a modified ISO/ANSI 8601 standard structured date format.
schema_documentation: The end of a period expressed in a modified ISO/ANSI 8601 standard structured format

Export_documentation:
The Julian day number (sequential day within the year) of the last day in the unit identification event period.

The year is given in {{{ISODateTimeEnd}}}.

The content range is 1-365 for normal years, 366 for leap years.
documentation:
Note that this element is not normally used in the context of an identification event.

The Julian day number for the last day in the unit identification event period.
abcd3_doc: The Julian day number for the last day of a period.
content:
The Julian day number (sequential day within the year) of the last day in the unit identification event period.

The year is given in {{{ISODateTimeEnd}}}.

The content range is 1-365 for normal years, 366 for leap years.
full_name: End of unit identification (Julian day number)
schema_documentation: The Julian day number of the last day in a period.

Export_documentation:
The time of day in decimal hours from midnight local time for the end of the unit identification event period.

Note that times are decimal hours: 13.5 represents 1:30 pm, not 1:05 pm, nor 1:50 pm.
documentation: The time of day in hours from midnight for the end of the unit identification event period.
abcd3_doc: The time of day in hours from midnight for the end of a period.
content:
Note that this element is not normally used in the context of an identification event.

The time of day in decimal hours from midnight local time for the end of the unit identification event period.

Note that times are decimal hours: 13.5 represents 1:30 pm, not 1:05 pm, nor 1:50 pm.
full_name: End of unit identification (time of day)
notes_total: Note that this element is not normally used in the context of an identification event.
schema_documentation: Time of day in hours from midnight for the end of a time period. This is also covered by ISODateTimeEnd, except in cases when the date is not known.

Export_documentation:
This is an indicator for the expliciteness of the unit identification event period.

This is set to 'true' if the unit identification event takes place for the period indicated. It is set to 'false' if it occurs at some point of time during the period, and is not filled if unknown or if no period is specified.
Export_example:
The execution of the unit identification event took exactly the time given as the period.

The unit identification event took place at some point during the period recorded here.

The exact timing and/or duration of the identification event is unknown or no period is specified.
documentation: This is an indicator for the expliciteness of the unit identification event period.
abcd3_doc: This is an indicator for the expliciteness of a period.
documentation_corrected: This is an indicator for the explicitness of the unit identification event period.
content:
Note that this element is not normally used in the context of an identification event.

This is an indicator for the expliciteness of the unit identification event period.

This is set to 'True' if the unit identification event takes place for the period indicated. It is set to false if it occurs at some point of time during the period, and is not filled if unknown or if no period is specified.
content_corrected: Note that this element is not normally used in the context of an identification event. This is an indicator for the explicitness of the unit identification event period. This is set as 'True' if the unit identification event takes place for the period indicated. It is set as false if it occurs at some point of time during the period, and is not filled if unknown or if no period is specified.
example_value:
The execution of the unit identification event took exactly the time given as the period.

The unit identification event took place at some point during the period recorded here.

The exact timing and/or duration of the identification event is unknown or no period is specified.
notes_total: Note that this element is not normally used in the context of an identification event.
schema_documentation: Set to True if the event takes place for the period indicated, set to false if it occurs at some point of time during the period, not filled if unknown or no period specified.

Export_documentation: The level to which the unit identification has been verified. Different standards may use different values here.
To Do:
ITF-2: https://github.com/tdwg/prior-standards/tree/master/itf2 HISPID-3: http://plantnet.rbgsyd.nsw.gov.au/HISCOM/HISPID/HISPID3/H3.html ITF-2 and HISPID-3 recognise the following values:

empty - not known whether the name of the record has been verified by an authority

0 (zero) - the name of the record has not been checked by any authority

1 - the name of the record determined by comparison with other named plants

2 - the name of the record determined by a taxonomist or by other competent persons using herbarium and/or library and/or documented living material

3 - the name of the plant determined by taxonomist engaged in systematic revision of the group

4 - The record is part of type gathering or propagated from type material by asexual methods
documentation: The level to which the unit identification has been verified. Different standards may use different values here.
abcd3_doc: The level to which the unit identification has been verified. Different standards may use different values here.
content:
The level to which the unit identification has been verified. Different standards may use different values here. For example, ITF-2 and HISPID-3 recognise the following values:

empty - not known whether the name of the record has been verified by an authority

0 (zero) - the name of the record has not been checked by any authority

1 - the name of the record determined by comparison with other named plants

2 - the name of the record determined by a taxonomist or by other competent persons using herbarium and/or library and/or documented living material

3 - the name of the plant determined by taxonomist engaged in systematic revision of the group

4 - The record is part of type gathering or propagated from type material by asexual methods
schema_documentation: The level to which the identification has been verified. Different standards may use different values here. See ITF-2 for an example.

Export_documentation:
The history of identifications for this unit (assigned identification results).

This is a free text field for use when extracting data from datasources where the identification or verification history (or part of it) is a free text field.

Under normal circumstances the history can be constructed by sorting identification events by date and reference to the preferred identification flag.
documentation: The history of identifications for this unit (assigned identification results).
abcd3_doc: The history of identifications for this unit (assigned identification results).
content:
The history of identifications for this unit (assigned identification results).

This is a free text field for use when extracting data from datasources where the identification or verification history (or part of it) is a free text field.

Under normal circumstances the history can be constructed by sorting identification events by date and reference to the preferred identification flag.
schema_documentation: This is a free text field for use when extracting data from data sources where the identification or verification history (or part of it) is a free text field. In normal circumstances the history can be constructed by sorting identification events by date and reference to the preferred identification flag

Export_documentation:
The legal owner or the representative of the owner of the physical specimen.

In the case of permanent loans, this is normally the institution holding the specimen (i.e. not the legal owner), with its {{{Role}}} indicated in the respective element of the contact type. In that case, the actual owner is then registered under {{{Acquisition/AcquiredFrom}}}, with the {{{Role}}} of the owner specified in the respective element there.
documentation: The legal owner of the physical specimen or their representative.
abcd3_doc: A concept to bundle contact information.
content:
The legal owner or the representative of the owner of the physical specimen.

In the case of permanent loans, this is normally the institution holding the specimen (i.e. not the legal owner), with its {{{Role}}} indicated in the respective element of the contact type. In that case, the actual owner is then registered under {{{Acquisition/AcquiredFrom}}}, with the {{{Role}}} of the owner specified in the respective element there.

The form consists of the following: Family name first followed by a comma then a space then given names or initials separated by a space.

Lastname, Firstname

Lastname, Firstname Middle-Initial

Export_documentation: The inherited name of the specimen owner. This may consist of family names, generational names, a clan name, parents or grandparents personal names, etc. The inherited name (this being the lastname in western cultures) may be compound (e.g. 'Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture, the inherited name is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to a married couple. Therefore, 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard (vCard: N-Family).
documentation: The inherited name of the specimen owner, which is the lastname in western cultures.
abcd3_doc: The inherited name of a person.
content: The inherited name of the specimen owner. This may consist of family names, generational names, a clan name, parents or grandparents personal names, etc. The inherited name (this being the lastname in western cultures) may be compound (e.g. 'Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture, the inherited name is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to a married couple. Therefore, 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard (vCard: N-Family).
schema_documentation: Family names, generational names, clan name, parents/grandparents personal names, etc. This (= last name in western cultures) may be compound ('Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture it is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to the married couple and children, thus 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard. (vCard:N.Family)

Export_documentation: The prefix to the specimen owner's inherited name. The prefix should be output before the name, but is usually not included in sorting. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard: N-Prefix)
documentation: The prefix to the specimen owner's inherited name.
abcd3_doc: The prefix to a persons inherited name.
content: The prefix to the specimen owner's inherited name. The prefix should be output before the name, but is usually not included in sorting. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard: N-Prefix)
schema_documentation: Prefix to inherited name that should be output before name, but is usually not included in sorting. Examples: 'von', 'Lord'. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard:N.Prefix)

Export_documentation:
The suffix for the name of the specimen owner. The suffix should be output after the name, regardless of whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not.

Examples: 'Jun.', 'III.'. (vCard: N-Suffix)
documentation: The suffix for the name of the specimen owner.
abcd3_doc: The suffix for the name of a person.
content:
The suffix for the name of the specimen owner. The suffix should be output after the name, regardless of whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not.

Examples: 'Jun.', 'III.'. (vCard: N-Suffix)
schema_documentation: Suffix to name that should be output after name, regardless whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not. Examples: 'Jun.', 'III.'. (vCard:N.Suffix)

Export_documentation: The personal name of the specimen's legal owner. The name given to the person as a personal name (the first or christian name in western cultures, including middle initials). The given name may contain several words. It is applicable only to people (vCard: N-Given + vCard: N-Middle).
documentation: The personal name of the specimen's legal owner, which is the first or christian name in western cultures.
abcd3_doc: The name of a person, which is the first or christian name in western cultures.
content: The personal name of the specimen's legal owner. The name given to the person as a personal name (the first or christian name in western cultures, including middle initials). The given name may contain several words. It is applicable only to people (vCard: N-Given + vCard: N-Middle).
schema_documentation: The name given to a person as a personal name (= first or Christian name in western cultures, including 'middle initials') may contain several words ('Ana Maria', 'Jerry B.'). Applicable only to persons. (vCard:N.Given + vCard:N.Middle)

Export_documentation: The preferred name of the specimen owner. The preferred name may differ from the first given name (e.g. second given name, nickname ('Bob' for 'Robert'), etc.) (vCard: Nickname).
documentation: The preferred name of the specimen owner.
abcd3_doc: The preferred name of a person.
content: The preferred name of the specimen owner. The preferred name may differ from the first given name (e.g. second given name, nickname ('Bob' for 'Robert'), etc.) (vCard: Nickname).
schema_documentation: May differ from the first given name: second given name, nickname ('Bob' for 'Robert'), etc. (vCard:Nickname)

documentation: Title for the role of the person or organisation owner of the specimen.
abcd3_doc: Title for the role of a contact.
content:
Title for the role of the person or organisation that is the owner of the specimen. This element can be used to provide a title such as "Database Administrator" or "Curator" when no individual person is named.

Analogue to vCard: Role : Functional contact name (e.g. "Database administrator", "The Director", etc.).
schema_documentation: Analogue to vCard:Role: Functional contact name, e.g. "Database administrator", "The Director", etc.

Export_documentation: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute, according to RFC 3066.
usage_notes:
The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .
documentation: Language
content: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute. This is a mandatory attribute. The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Export_documentation: The address marked as preferred by means of this attribute should be the first used, the other addresses named should be regarded as alternate addresses.
example_explanation: The element with its attribute set to true is the preferred address.
To Do: add the following (former recommended) to documentation and restriction true, false or empty. For a single unbounded element there should only be one with the @preferred attribute set to true.

content: The address marked as preferred by means of this attribute should be the first used, the other addresses named should be regarded as alternate addresses.

Export_documentation: Full telephone or fax number for the legal owner of the specimen.
usage_notes:
Numbers should be provided in the ITU (International Telecommunication Union) international format ("+Country-Code Area-Code Number").  

The preferred attribute @preferred indicates the preferred number.
documentation: Telephone or fax number for the legal owner of the specimen.

Telephone or fax number for the legal owner of the specimen.

Numbers should be provided in the ITU international format ("+Country-Code Area-Code Number").

The preferred attribute @preferred indicates the preferred number.
schema_documentation: Telephone or fax number

Export_documentation: The telephone number marked as preferred by means of this attribute should be the first approached. The other telephone numbers should be regarded as alternative numbers.
example_explanation: The element with its attribute set to true is the preferred telephone number.
To Do: add the following (former recommended) to documentation or restriction: true, false, or empty. For a single unbounded element there should only be one with the @preferred attribute set to true.

content: The telephone number marked as preferred by means of this attribute should be the first approached. The other telephone numbers should be regarded as alternative numbers.

Export_documentation: Full telephone or fax number of the specimen owner.
usage_notes:
Numbers should be provided in the ITU (International Telecommunication Union) international format ("+Country-Code Area-Code Number").  

The preferred attribute @preferred indicates the preferred number.

content:
Full telephone or fax number of the specimen owner.

Numbers should be provided in the ITU Recommendation E.164 international format ("+Country-Code Area-Code Number").

notes_total: I added the group, which also applies to all elements contained.

Export_documentation:
The date that the specimen was acquired by the institution.

Date on which the accession entered the collection as YYYYMMDD. Missing data (MM or DD) should be indicated with hyphens. Leading zeros are required.
To Do: A FAO/IPGRI multi-crop passport descriptor (MCPD), description and examples taken from EURISCO descriptor list dated July 3, 2002. http://www.bioversityinternational.org/uploads/tx_news/FAO-Bioversity_multi_crop_passport_descriptors_V_2_Final_rev_1526.pdf
documentation: A textual statement of the date of acquisition of the specimen by the institution.
abcd3_doc: Concept to describe date and time (and periods).
content:
The date that the specimen was acquired by the institution.

Date on which the accession entered the collection as YYYYMMDD. Missing data (MM or DD) should be indicated with hyphens. Leading zeros are required. A FAO/IPGRI multi-crop passport descriptor (MCPD), description and examples taken from EURISCO descriptor list dated July 3, 2002.
schema_documentation: Textual statement of the date of acquisition of the specimen by the institution

Abbreviation representing the organisation from which the specimen was acquired or the organisation associated with the person from whom the specimen was acquired.

Restricted to 50 characters maximum length, including blanks (shorter recommended!).

Label abbreviations are especially important when displaying information in a tabular format.

Export_documentation:
The name of person as normally used representing the person from whom the specimen was acquired.

The name may include titles. Preferred form of personal name for display as a string.
documentation: String of the preferred form of personal name for display representing the person from whom the specimen was acquired.
abcd3_doc: String of the preferred form of personal name for displaying.
content:
The name of person as normally used representing the person from whom the specimen was acquired.

The name may include titles.
full_name: Person specimen was acquired from (full name)
schema_documentation: Preferred form of personal name for display as a string.

Export_documentation:
The full name of the person from whom the specimen was acquired in a form appropriate for sorting alphabetically.

The form consists of the following: Family name first followed by a comma then a space then given names or initials separated by a space.
example_explanation:
Lastname, Firstname

Lastname, Firstname Middle-Initial
documentation: The full name of the person from whom the specimen was acquired in a form appropriate for sorting alphabetically. (vCard: Sort-String)
abcd3_doc: The full name of a person in a form appropriate for sorting alphabetically.
content:
The full name of the person from whom the specimen was acquired in a form appropriate for sorting alphabetically.

The form consists of the following: Family name first followed by a comma then a space then given names or initials separated by a space.
full_name: Person specimen was acquired from (sort name)
schema_documentation: The full name with the elements in preferred sorting sequence (vCard: Sort-String).

Export_documentation: Atomised name of the person from whom the specimen was acquired.
documentation: Atomised name of the person from whom the specimen was acquired.
content: Atomised name of the person from whom the specimen was acquired.
schema_documentation: Atomised name of the person.

Export_documentation: The inherited name of the person from whom the specimen was acquired. This may consist of family names, generational names, a clan name, parents or grandparents personal names, etc. The inherited name (this being the lastname in western cultures) may be compound (e.g. 'Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture, the inherited name is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to a married couple. Therefore, 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard (vCard: N-Family).
documentation: The inherited name of the person from whom the specimen was acquired, which is the lastname in western cultures.
abcd3_doc: The inherited name of a person.
content: The inherited name of the person from whom the specimen was acquired. This may consist of family names, generational names, a clan name, parents or grandparents personal names, etc. The inherited name (this being the lastname in western cultures) may be compound (e.g. 'Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture, the inherited name is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to a married couple. Therefore, 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard (vCard: N-Family).
full_name: Person specimen was acquired from (inherited name)
schema_documentation: Family names, generational names, clan name, parents/grandparents personal names, etc. This (= last name in western cultures) may be compound ('Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture it is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to the married couple and children, thus 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard. (vCard:N.Family)

Export_documentation: The prefix to the inherited name of the person from whom the specimen was acquired. The prefix should be output before the name, but is usually not included in sorting. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard: N-Prefix)
documentation: The prefix to the inherited name of the person from whom the specimen was acquired.
abcd3_doc: The prefix to a persons inherited name.
content: The prefix to the inherited name of the person from whom the specimen was acquired. The prefix should be output before the name, but is usually not included in sorting. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard: N-Prefix)
full_name: Person specimen was acquired from (inherited name prefix)
schema_documentation: Prefix to inherited name that should be output before name, but is usually not included in sorting. Examples: 'von', 'Lord'. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard:N.Prefix)

Export_documentation: The suffix for the name of the person from whom the specimen was acquired. The suffix should be output after the name, regardless of whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not (vCard: N-Suffix).
documentation: The suffix for the name of the person from whom the specimen was acquired.
abcd3_doc: The suffix for the name of a person.
content: The suffix for the name of the person from whom the specimen was acquired. The suffix should be output after the name, regardless of whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not (vCard: N-Suffix).
full_name: Person specimen was acquired from (name suffix)
schema_documentation: Suffix to name that should be output after name, regardless whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not. Examples: 'Jun.', 'III.'. (vCard:N.Suffix)

Export_documentation: The personal name of the person from whom the specimen was acquired. The name given to the person as a personal name (the first or christian name in western cultures, including middle initials). The given name may contain several words. It is applicable only to people (vCard: N-Given + vCard: N-Middle).
documentation: The personal name of the person from whom the specimen was acquired, which is the first or christian name in western cultures.
abcd3_doc: The name of a person, which is the first or christian name in western cultures.
content: The personal name of the person from whom the specimen was acquired. The name given to the person as a personal name (the first or christian name in western cultures, including middle initials). The given name may contain several words. It is applicable only to people (vCard: N-Given + vCard: N-Middle).
full_name: Person specimen was acquired from (given names)
schema_documentation: The name given to a person as a personal name (= first or Christian name in western cultures, including 'middle initials') may contain several words ('Ana Maria', 'Jerry B.'). Applicable only to persons. (vCard:N.Given + vCard:N.Middle)

Export_documentation: The preferred name of the person from whom the specimen was acquired. The preferred name may differ from the first given name (e.g. second given name, nickname ('Bob' for 'Robert'), etc.) (vCard: Nickname).

content: The preferred name of the person from whom the specimen was acquired. The preferred name may differ from the first given name (e.g. second given name, nickname ('Bob' for 'Robert'), etc.) (vCard: Nickname).

Export_documentation:
The name of person as normally used representing the specimen preparation agent.

The name may include titles. Preferred form of personal name for display as a string.

abcd3_doc: String of the preferred form of personal name for displaying.

The name of person as normally used representing the specimen preparation agent.

The name may include titles.
schema_documentation: Preferred form of personal name for display as a string.

Export_documentation:
The full name of the person acting as or representing the specimen preparation agent in a form appropriate for sorting alphabetically.

The form consists of the following: Family name first followed by a comma then a space then given names or initials separated by a space.
example_explanation:
Lastname, Firstname

Lastname, Firstname Middle-Initial
documentation: The full name of the person acting as or representing the specimen preparation agent in a form appropriate for sorting alphabetically. (vCard: Sort-String)
abcd3_doc: The full name of a person in a form appropriate for sorting alphabetically.
content:
The full name of the person acting as or representing the specimen preparation agent in a form appropriate for sorting alphabetically.

The form consists of the following: Family name first followed by a comma then a space then given names or initials separated by a space.
schema_documentation: The full name with the elements in preferred sorting sequence (vCard: Sort-String).

Export_documentation: The atomised name of the person acting as or representing the specimen preparation agent.
documentation: The atomized name of the person acting as or representing the specimen preparation agent.
content: The atomized name of the person acting as or representing the specimen preparation agent.
schema_documentation: Atomised name of the person.

Export_documentation: The inherited name of the person acting as or representing the specimen preparation agent. This may consist of family names, generational names, a clan name, parents or grandparents personal names, etc. The inherited name (this being the lastname in western cultures) may be compound (e.g. 'Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture, the inherited name is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to a married couple. Therefore, 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard (vCard: N-Family).
documentation: The inherited name of the person acting as or representing the specimen preparation agent, which is the lastname in western cultures.
abcd3_doc: The inherited name of a person.
content: The inherited name of the person acting as or representing the specimen preparation agent. This may consist of family names, generational names, a clan name, parents or grandparents personal names, etc. The inherited name (this being the lastname in western cultures) may be compound (e.g. 'Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture, the inherited name is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to a married couple. Therefore, 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard (vCard: N-Family).
schema_documentation: Family names, generational names, clan name, parents/grandparents personal names, etc. This (= last name in western cultures) may be compound ('Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture it is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to the married couple and children, thus 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard. (vCard:N.Family)

Export_documentation: The prefix to the specimen preparation agent's inherited name. The prefix should be output before the name, but is usually not included in sorting. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard: N-Prefix)
documentation: The prefix to the specimen preparation agent's inherited name.
abcd3_doc: The prefix to a persons inherited name.
content: The prefix to the specimen preparation agent's inherited name. The prefix should be output before the name, but is usually not included in sorting. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard: N-Prefix)
schema_documentation: Prefix to inherited name that should be output before name, but is usually not included in sorting. Examples: 'von', 'Lord'. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard:N.Prefix)

Export_documentation: The suffix for the name of the person acting as or representing the specimen preparation agent.  The suffix should be output after the name, regardless of whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not (vCard: N-Suffix).
documentation: The suffix for the name of the person acting as or representing the specimen preparation agent.
abcd3_doc: The suffix for the name of a person.
content: The suffix for the name of the person acting as or representing the specimen preparation agent.  The suffix should be output after the name, regardless of whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not (vCard: N-Suffix).
schema_documentation: Suffix to name that should be output after name, regardless whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not. Examples: 'Jun.', 'III.'. (vCard:N.Suffix)

Export_documentation: The personal name of the person acting as or representing the specimen preparation agent. The name given to the person as a personal name (the first or christian name in western cultures, including middle initials). The given name may contain several words. It is applicable only to people (vCard: N-Given + vCard: N-Middle).
documentation: The personal name of the person acting as or representing the specimen preparation agent, which is the first or christian name in western cultures.
abcd3_doc: The name of a person, which is the first or christian name in western cultures.
content: The personal name of the person acting as or representing the specimen preparation agent. The name given to the person as a personal name (the first or christian name in western cultures, including middle initials). The given name may contain several words. It is applicable only to people (vCard: N-Given + vCard: N-Middle).
schema_documentation: The name given to a person as a personal name (= first or Christian name in western cultures, including 'middle initials') may contain several words ('Ana Maria', 'Jerry B.'). Applicable only to persons. (vCard:N.Given + vCard:N.Middle)

Export_documentation: The preferred name of the person acting as or representing the specimen preparation agent. The preferred name may differ from the first given name (e.g. second given name, nickname ('Bob' for 'Robert'), etc.) (vCard: Nickname).

Export_documentation: Dates that the specimen was held by a previous collection.

Export_documentation:
A text version (alphabetic mixed case and integer) of the date(s) during which the unit was held by a previous collection. This element is meant for use when the date is imprecise, ambiguous or not in a form that satisfies the standard structured date format. It can also be used when it is important to record the verbatim representation of the date or when dates to be recorded are not completely legible. For example the day and month may be decipherable but not the year; the use of this field will allow recording of partially interpreted information.

This field can be used to record generalised date ranges and irresolvable ambiguity such as different day/month order conventions (e.g. US/Europe) or to allow for multiple dates and periods.

In the rare instances of dates for periods before the year 0000, BC and similar dates can be recorded in this field.
Export_example:
25 [?] 1925

3/9/45 [ambiguous day month]

Spring 1912

Late 1800s

End of 19th Century

Mid 1978

Easter 1933

Post WW2

Before June 25, 2000

After June 25, 2000
documentation: The date(s) the specimen was held by a previous collection in text format.
abcd3_doc: A date in text format.
content:
A text version (alphabetic mixed case and integer) of the date(s) during which the unit was held by a previous collection. This element is meant for use when the date is imprecise, ambiguous or not in a form that satisfies the standard structured date format. It can also be used when it is important to record the verbatim representation of the date or when dates to be recorded are not completely legible. For example the day and month may be decipherable but not the year; the use of this field will allow recording of partially interpreted information.

This field can be used to record generalised date ranges and irresolvable ambiguity such as different day/month order conventions (e.g. US/Europe) or to allow for multiple dates and periods.

In the rare instances of dates for periods before the year 0000, BC and similar dates can be recorded in this field.
example_value:
25 [?] 1925

3/9/45 [ambiguous day month]

Spring 1912

Late 1800s

End of 19th Century

Mid 1978

Easter 1933

Post WW2

Before June 25, 2000

After June 25, 2000
full_name: Date(s) specimen held by previous collection (text)
schema_documentation: The date in text format

Export_documentation:
The time zone to which the time-of-day data for the specimen's history refer.

Timezone expressed in minutes in accordance with the "seven property model" for date/time attributes in XML schema ( http://www.w3.org/TR/2004/WD-xmlschema11-2-20040716/#theSevenPropertyModel).

An integer between -840 and 840 inclusive (+/- 14 hours).
example_explanation:
UTM + 9 hours 30 minutes (Australia Central Standard)

UTM - 5 hours (Eastern Standard Time)

The content range is 1-365 for normal years, 366 for leap years.

Export_documentation:
Time of day in decimal hours from midnight local time for an exact point in time or for the beginning of a time period during which the specimen was held by a previous collection.

This field may apply to times of collecting where this is considered important.

Note that times are decimial hours: 13.5 represents 1:30 pm, not 1:05 pm, nor 1:50 pm.

This field may apply to times of collecting where this is considered important.

Note that times are decimial hours: 13.5 represents 1:30 pm, not 1:05 pm, nor 1:50 pm.

Time can also be expressed in the ISO {{{DateTimeElement}}}.

Maps to Darwin Core 2: Time of Day.

Export_documentation:
This is an indicator for the expliciteness of the period recorded here as the time during which a specimen was held by a previous collection.

This is set to 'true' if the specimen was held during the period indicated. It is set to 'false' if the specimen was held by the collection at some point of time during the period, and is not filled if unknown or if no period is specified.
Export_example:
The specimen was held by the previous collection for exactly the time given as the period.

The specimen was held by the previous collection during the period recorded here.

The exact timing and/or duration of the period that the specimen was held by the previous collection is unknown or no period is specified.

Export_documentation: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute, according to RFC 3066.
usage_notes:
The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .
documentation: Language
content: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute. This is a mandatory attribute. The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Export_documentation: The name based on the specimen.
documentation: The name based on the specimen.
abcd3_doc: The name of an identified taxon. Formed according to the different Codes of Nomenclature which apply to scientific names.
content: The name based on the specimen.
editorial_notes:
An alternative solution to this unstructured element would be the use of the scientific name structure given under identification.

It has been suggested to treat the type assignation as a special case of identification. Although this is without doubt true, it would mean to introduce the entire typification structure to the identification structure (because more than on name may be directly typified by the same specimen). As nomeclatural types are only a subtype of specimens, and these are only a subtype of units, it was decided to assign the typified name in the specimen domain. If it is to be found by a normal name search, it should be repeated as an identified name under identifications.
notes_total:
An alternative solution to this unstructured element would be the use of the scientific name structure given under identification.

It has been suggested to treat the type assignation as a special case of identification. Although this is without doubt true, it would mean to introduce the entire typification structure to the identification structure (because more than on name may be directly typified by the same specimen). As nomeclatural types are only a subtype of specimens, and these are only a subtype of units, it was decided to assign the typified name in the specimen domain. If it is to be found by a normal name search, it should be repeated as an identified name under identifications.
schema_documentation: The name based on the specimen.

Export_documentation: A concatenated scientific name for the nomenclatural type designation for the specimen, preferrably fully formed in accordance with a Code of Nomenclature (i. e. a monomial, bionomial, or trinomial plus author(s) or author team(s) and - where relevant - year), or the name of a cultivar or cultivar group.

Export_documentation:
One of the following, representing the genus, or higher taxon name, that is part of the nomenclatural type designation for the unit.

A generic name as a botanical scientific name or as part of it.

A generic name under one of the established nomenclatural codes

A manuscript name

An intergeneric hybrid name under the ICBN, without the leading multiplication sign,

The name of an intergeneric graft hybrid or graft chimaera, published under the Cultivated Code.

Rules:

1. First letter capitalised.

2. No spaces included.
To Do: see editorial_notes; see discussion on higher taxon name

One of the following, representing the genus, or higher taxon name, that is part of the nomenclatural type designation for the unit.

A generic name as a botancal scientific name or as part of it.

A generic name under one of the established nomenclatural codes

A manuscript name

An intergeneric hybrid name under the ICBN, without the leading multiplication sign,

The name of an intergeneric graft hybrid or graft chimaera, published under the Cultivated Code.

Rules:

1. First letter capitalised.

2. No spaces included.
editorial_notes: Generic names are essentially the same under the different codes; however, to avoid having to place the essential parts of a name on different levels of the hierarchy, all name elements recognized under a specific code are listed in the respective section.

Note that quadrinomials etc. are not supported here as names; if deemed necessary, they can be entered in the FullScientificNameString, this element should than contain the last infraspecific epithet.

Export_documentation: A flag indicating that the unit identified is a named hybrid ("x") or a graft chimaera ("+").
documentation: A flag indicating that the specimen type designation is a named hybrid or a graft chimaera.
abcd3_doc: A flag indicating that the unit identified is a named hybrid or a graft chimaera.
content:
A flag indicating that the nomenclatural type designation for the specimen is a named hybrid or a graft chimaera.

The attribute Rank defines if this applies to the generic, species, or infraspecific level.

The full name of the type status verifier in a form appropriate for sorting alphabetically.

The form consists of the following: Family name first followed by a comma then a space then given names or initials separated by a space.
example_explanation:
Lastname, Firstname

Lastname, Firstname Middle-Initial

The full name of the type status verifier in a form appropriate for sorting alphabetically.

content: Atomized name of the type status verifier.
schema_documentation: Atomised name of the person.

Export_documentation: The inherited name of the type status verifier. This may consist of family names, generational names, a clan name, parents or grandparents personal names, etc. The inherited name (this being the lastname in western cultures) may be compound (e.g. 'Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture, the inherited name is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to a married couple. Therefore, 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard (vCard: N-Family).
documentation: The inherited name of the type status verifier, which is the lastname in western cultures.
abcd3_doc: The inherited name of a person.
content: The inherited name of the type status verifier. This may consist of family names, generational names, a clan name, parents or grandparents personal names, etc. The inherited name (this being the lastname in western cultures) may be compound (e.g. 'Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture, the inherited name is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to a married couple. Therefore, 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard (vCard: N-Family).
schema_documentation: Family names, generational names, clan name, parents/grandparents personal names, etc. This (= last name in western cultures) may be compound ('Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture it is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to the married couple and children, thus 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard. (vCard:N.Family)

Export_documentation: The prefix to the type status verifier's inherited name. The prefix should be output before the name, but is usually not included in sorting. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard: N-Prefix)

abcd3_doc: The prefix to a persons inherited name.
content: The prefix to the type status verifier's inherited name. The prefix should be output before the name, but is usually not included in sorting. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard: N-Prefix)
full_name: Type status verifier's inherited name prefix
schema_documentation: Prefix to inherited name that should be output before name, but is usually not included in sorting. Examples: 'von', 'Lord'. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard:N.Prefix)

Export_documentation: The suffix for the name of the type status verifier. The suffix should be output after the name, regardless of whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not (vCard: N-Suffix).

abcd3_doc: The suffix for the name of a person.
content: The suffix for the name of the type status verifier. The suffix should be output after the name, regardless of whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not (vCard: N-Suffix).
schema_documentation: Suffix to name that should be output after name, regardless whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not. Examples: 'Jun.', 'III.'. (vCard:N.Suffix)

Export_documentation: The personal name of the type status verifier. The name given to the person as a personal name (the first or christian name in western cultures, including middle initials). The given name may contain several words. It is applicable only to people (vCard: N-Given + vCard: N-Middle).

content: The personal name of the type status verifier. The name given to the person as a personal name (the first or christian name in western cultures, including middle initials). The given name may contain several words. It is applicable only to people (vCard: N-Given + vCard: N-Middle).
schema_documentation: The name given to a person as a personal name (= first or Christian name in western cultures, including 'middle initials') may contain several words ('Ana Maria', 'Jerry B.'). Applicable only to persons. (vCard:N.Given + vCard:N.Middle)

Export_documentation: The preferred name of the type status verifier. The preferred name may differ from the first given name (e.g. second given name, nickname ('Bob' for 'Robert'), etc.) (vCard: Nickname).

Export_documentation: The current status of the accession in the garden.
To Do:
ITF-2: https://github.com/tdwg/prior-standards/tree/master/itf2 The status may be C,D, T, S, or O.

C (current accession in the living collection)

D (non-current due to death)

T (non current due to transfer to another record system, normally another garden)

S (stored in a dormant state)

O (other accession status - different from those above)
documentation: The current status of the accession in the garden (current or not current).
abcd3_doc: The current status of the accession in the garden (current or not current).
content:
The current status of the accession in the garden. The status may be C,D, T, S, or O.

C (current accession in the living collection)

D (non-current due to death)

T (non current due to transfer to another record system, normally another garden)

S (stored in a dormant state)

O (other accession status - different from those above)


Field definition taken from ITF 2.

Export_documentation: A unique number given to plant materials accessioned in conformance with the rules of the International Plant Exchange Network (see http://www.bgci.org/abs/ipen_numbers.html).
example_explanation:
XX for unknown country of origin, 0 no special caveats for handing on the material, WU = Bot. Garden Vienna has introduced the material to the network and holds original infromation, 1989/2769: Accession number in WU.

Second example analoguous, origin is United States, introducing garden is Tharandt.

Third example: Material from Georgia, restricted (restrictions have to be enquired at the botanical garden M = Munich).
To Do: Rules?; see International Plant Exchange Network (see http://www.bgci.org/abs/ipen_numbers.htm

Export_documentation:
Code for the (location-) provenance of the unit.

The coding scheme proposed can be used at 2 different levels of detail: either by using the general codes (in boldface) such as 10, 20, 30, 40 or by using the more specific codes such as 11, 12 etc. A FAO/IPGRI multi-crop passport descriptor (MCPD), description and examples taken from EURISCO descriptor list dated July 3, 2002.
10) Wild habitat
11) Forest/woodland
12) Shrubland
13) Grassland
14) Desert/tundra
15) Aquatic habitat

20) Farm or cultivated habitat
21) Field
22) Orchard
23) Backyard, kitchen or home garden (urban, peri-urban or rural)
24) Fallow land
25) Pasture
26) Farm store
27) Threshing floor
28) Park

30) Market or shop

40) Institute, Experimental station, Research organisation, Genebank

50) Seed company

60) Weedy, disturbed or ruderal habitat
61) Roadside
62) Field margin

99) Other (Elaborate in REMARKS field)
To Do: FAO/IPGRI multi-crop passport descriptor (MCPD), description and examples taken from EURISCO descriptor list dated July 3, 2002

Export_documentation:
Any other identification (numbers) known to exist in other collections for this accession.

Use the following system: {{{INSTCODE:ACCENUMB;INSTCODE:ACCENUMB;}}}

INSTCODE and ACCENUMB follow the standard described above and are separated by a colon. Pairs of INSTCODE and ACCENUMB are separated by a semicolon without space. When the institute is not known, the number should be preceded by a colon.

editorial_notes:
The following email was received from Dag Terje Endresen of the Nordic Genebank on June 3, 2005:

I have looked a little bit into what is the definition of the MCPD concept of ACCENAME (Accession name). I found most central crop databases using the exact same definition as published by the MCPD list from IPGRI: "Either a registered or other formal designation given to the accession. First letter uppercase. Multiple names separated with semicolon without space." Interestingly the concept seems to have been called "cultivar name" in the first versions. In the majority of cases in the NGB database the accession name is identical to the commercial cultivar name. The concept has however sometimes also another content than only repeating the cultivar name. Often for genetic resources the genebank makes selections in the original accession and the resulting sub-sets are often classified as still belonging to the cultivar but given a new accession name. I inlude an example from NGB of this in a Finnish cultivar of Barley.

NGB30 TAIPALE ME0201; OTRA MIX

NGB31 SAVIKYL ME0201; OTRA MIX;

NGB36 LAPJRVI ME0402; OTRA MIX

NGB291 OTRA

NGB777 YLITORNIO JP0101; OTRA MIX

NGB781 SASSALI ME0801; OTRA MIX

NGB782 MURTOMAA ME0901; OTRA/HANKKIJA-673

NGB783 UIMANIEMI ME1001; OTRA

NGB784 KUUSELA 1101; OTRA MIX

NGB787 KELUJRVI EH0601; OTRA MIX

NGB1162 KASURILA 0401; OTRA

NGB1163 LUIKONLAHTI ME0302; OTRA

NGB1164 SUOTTALA ME0402; OTRA

NGB2804 PERNNE AP0103; OTRA

NGB2820 KNNI 0401; OTRA

I hope this is helpful for finding the content of the ACCENAME concept. I include also below some online information on the MCPD concept _Accession Name_

== Definition from MCPD ==

http://www.ipgri.cgiar.org/publications/pubfile+.asp?ID_PUB=124

11 Accession name (ACCENAME)

Either a registered or other formal designation given to the accession. First letter uppercase. Multiple names separated with semicolon without space.

Example: Rheinische Vorgebirgstrauben;Emma;Avlon



== The ECP/GR Pyrus Database [http://www.cra.wallonie.be/pyrus/passport.htm] ==

NB : For "accession name", as a general rule the accepted name is the first published name in the pomological literature ; the name must be given in its original language without translation but in international alphabet form. There are, however, exceptions such as when a subsequent name have been so frequently used that it is then taken as the accepted name. For "landraces" each curator has to decide which synonyn fit the best. Subsequently it will be possible to have a field in the database devoted to synonyns.



== European Central Crop Databases for Lolium and Trifolium repens (ECCDBs) ==

It is based on the European Forage Passport Descriptor List (EFPDL)* which is itself an extended version of the FAO/IPGRI Multi-Crop Passport Descriptors. http://www.igergru.bbsrc.ac.uk/Welcome/ECCDB/descriptors/descriptors.htm

(ACCNAME) - Cultivar name, Breeder's number or any other formal designation given to the accession. E.g. 'Aberystwyth S23'.



== Report of the Technical Meeting on the Methodology of WIEWS ==

Radzikow, Poland, 30 September - 3 October 1996

9. The Meeting appreciated the cooperation between FAO and IPGRI in harmonizing multi-crop descriptors for common use in WIEWS, IPGRI crop descriptor lists and for reporting from databases (Appendix 8). The Meeting proposed the following changes in the list:

- to change the name of descriptor no. 5 from "Cultivar name" to "Accession name",

The following email was received from Dag Terje Endresen of the Nordic Genebank on June 3, 2005:

I have looked a little bit into what is the definition of the MCPD concept of ACCENAME (Accession name). I found most central crop databases using the exact same definition as published by the MCPD list from IPGRI: "Either a registered or other formal designation given to the accession. First letter uppercase. Multiple names separated with semicolon without space." Interestingly the concept seems to have been called "cultivar name" in the first versions. In the majority of cases in the NGB database the accession name is identical to the commercial cultivar name. The concept has however sometimes also another content than only repeating the cultivar name. Often for genetic resources the genebank makes selections in the original accession and the resulting sub-sets are often classified as still belonging to the cultivar but given a new accession name. I inlude an example from NGB of this in a Finnish cultivar of Barley.

NGB30 TAIPALE ME0201; OTRA MIX

NGB31 SAVIKYL ME0201; OTRA MIX;

NGB36 LAPJRVI ME0402; OTRA MIX

NGB291 OTRA

NGB777 YLITORNIO JP0101; OTRA MIX

NGB781 SASSALI ME0801; OTRA MIX

== Definition from MCPD ==

http://www.ipgri.cgiar.org/publications/pubfile+.asp?ID_PUB=124

Either a registered or other formal designation given to the accession. First letter uppercase. Multiple names separated with semicolon without space.

Example: Rheinische Vorgebirgstrauben;Emma;Avlon



== The ECP/GR Pyrus Database [http://www.cra.wallonie.be/pyrus/passport.htm] ==

NB : For "accession name", as a general rule the accepted name is the first published name in the pomological literature ; the name must be given in its original language without translation but in international alphabet form. There are, however, exceptions such as when a subsequent name have been so frequently used that it is then taken as the accepted name. For "landraces" each curator has to decide which synonyn fit the best. Subsequently it will be possible to have a field in the database devoted to synonyns.



== European Central Crop Databases for Lolium and Trifolium repens (ECCDBs) ==

It is based on the European Forage Passport Descriptor List (EFPDL)* which is itself an extended version of the FAO/IPGRI Multi-Crop Passport Descriptors. http://www.igergru.bbsrc.ac.uk/Welcome/ECCDB/descriptors/descriptors.htm

(ACCNAME) - Cultivar name, Breeder's number or any other formal designation given to the accession. E.g. 'Aberystwyth S23'.



== Report of the Technical Meeting on the Methodology of WIEWS ==

Radzikow, Poland, 30 September - 3 October 1996

9. The Meeting appreciated the cooperation between FAO and IPGRI in harmonizing multi-crop descriptors for common use in WIEWS, IPGRI crop descriptor lists and for reporting from databases (Appendix 8). The Meeting proposed the following changes in the list:

- to change the name of descriptor no. 5 from "Cultivar name" to "Accession name",

Export_documentation:
A text version (alphabetic mixed case and integer) of the date that the gathering event took place. This element is meant for use when the date is imprecise, ambiguous or not in a form that satisfies the standard structured date format. It can also be used when it is important to record the verbatim representation of the date or when dates to be recorded are not completely legible. For example the day and month may be decipherable but not the year; the use of this field will allow recording of partially interpreted information.

This field can be used to record generalised date ranges and irresolvable ambiguity such as different day/month order conventions (e.g. US/Europe) or to allow for multiple dates and periods.

In the rare instances of dates for periods before the year 0000, BC and similar dates can be recorded in this field.
Export_example:
25 [?] 1925

3/9/45 [ambiguous day month]

Spring 1912

Late 1800s

End of 19th Century

Mid 1978

Easter 1933

Post WW2

Before June 25, 2000

After June 25, 2000
documentation: The date of the gathering event in text format.
abcd3_doc: A date in text format.
content:
A text version (alphabetic mixed case and integer) of the date that the gathering event took place. This element is meant for use when the date is imprecise, ambiguous or not in a form that satisfies the standard structured date format. It can also be used when it is important to record the verbatim representation of the date or when dates to be recorded are not completely legible. For example the day and month may be decipherable but not the year; the use of this field will allow recording of partially interpreted information.

This field can be used to record generalised date ranges and irresolvable ambiguity such as different day/month order conventions (e.g. US/Europe) or to allow for multiple dates and periods.

In the rare instances of dates for periods before the year 0000, BC and similar dates can be recorded in this field.

3/9/45 [ambiguous day month]

Spring 1912

Late 1800s

End of 19th Century

Mid 1978

Easter 1933

Before June 25, 2000

Export_documentation:
The time zone to which the time-of-day data for the gathering event refer.

Timezone expressed in minutes in accordance with the "seven property model" for date/time attributes in XML schema ( http://www.w3.org/TR/2004/WD-xmlschema11-2-20040716/#theSevenPropertyModel).

An integer between -840 and 840 inclusive (+/- 14 hours).
example_explanation:
UTM + 9 hours 30 minutes (Australia Central Standard)

UTM - 5 hours (Eastern Standard Time)
documentation: The time zone to which the time-of-day data for the gathering event refer.
content:
The time zone to which the time-of-day data for the gathering event refer.

Timezone expressed in minutes in accordance with the "seven property model" for date/time attributes in XML schema ( http://www.w3.org/TR/2004/WD-xmlschema11-2-20040716/#theSevenPropertyModel).

Export_documentation: The exact date (and time) or beginning of a period representing the gathering event, expressed in a modified ISO/ANSI 8601 standard structured date format.
usage_notes: The date format looks like this: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS with flexible precision.
To Do: FAO/IPGRI multi-crop passport descriptor (MCPD), description and examples taken from EURISCO descriptor list dated July 3, 2002
documentation: The beginning of the gathering event, or exact date, expressed in a modified ISO/ANSI structured format.
abcd3_doc: The point in time of the beginning of a period expressed in a modified ISO/ANSI structured format.
content:
The exact date (and time) or beginning of a period representing the gathering event, expressed in a modified ISO/ANSI 8601 standard structured date format.

The collecting date of the sample as YYYYMMDD. Missing data (MM or DD) should be indicated with hyphens. Leading zeros are required. A FAO/IPGRI multi-crop passport descriptor (MCPD), description and examples taken from EURISCO descriptor list dated July 3, 2002.
schema_documentation: The exact date (and time) or beginning of a period, expressed in a modified ISO/ANSI 8601 standard structured format

Export_documentation:
The Julian day number (or sequential day) in the year for the exact date or for the first day of the gathering event. The year is given in ISO-Date-Time-Begin.

The content range is 1-365 for normal years, 366 for leap years.

Maps to Darwin Core 2: Julian Day.

content:
The Julian day number (or sequential day) in the year for the exact date or for the first day of the gathering event. The year is given in ISO-Date-Time-Begin.

The content range is 1-365 for normal years, 366 for leap years.
