Export_documentation:
The time of day in decimal hours from midnight local time for an exact point in time or for the beginning of the gathering event.

This field may apply to times of collecting where this is considered important.

Note that times are decimial hours: 13.5 represents 1:30 pm, not 1:05 pm, nor 1:50 pm.

Maps to Darwin Core 2: Time of Day.

This field may apply to times of collecting where this is considered important.

Note that times are decimial hours: 13.5 represents 1:30 pm, not 1:05 pm, nor 1:50 pm.

Time can also be expressed in the {{{ISODateTimeElement}}}.

Maps to Darwin Core 2: Time of Day.

Export_documentation:
This is an indicator for the expliciteness of the gathering event time period.

This is set to 'true' if the gathering event takes place for the period indicated. It is set to false' if it occurs at some point of time during the period, and is not filled if unknown or if no period is specified.
Export_example:
The execution of the unit identification event took exactly the time given as the period.

The unit identification event took place at some point during the period recorded here.

The exact timing and/or duration of the identification event is unknown or no period is specified.
To Do: example values vs. documentation, add restrictions
documentation: This is an indicator for the expliciteness of the gathering event time period.
abcd3_doc: This is an indicator for the expliciteness of a period.
content:
This is an indicator for the expliciteness of the gathering event time period.

This is set to 'True' if the gathering event takes place for the period indicated. It is set to false if it occurs at some point of time during the period, and is not filled if unknown or if no period is specified.
content_corrected: This is an indicator for the expliciteness of the gathering event time period. This is set as 'True' if the gathering event takes place for the period indicated. It is set as false if it occurs at some point of time during the period, and is not filled if unknown or if no period is specified.
example_value:
The execution of the unit identification event took exactly the time given as the period.

The unit identification event took place at some point during the period recorded here.

The exact timing and/or duration of the identification event is unknown or no period is specified.
schema_documentation: Set to True if the event takes place for the period indicated, set to false if it occurs at some point of time during the period, not filled if unknown or no period specified.

Export_documentation: A container element for several gathering agent(s) responsible for collecting or recording (either a single person or several persons forming a team or an organisation or (sometimes) a project name).

Export_documentation:
A person or one of a group of persons, team(s), or organisations responsible for collecting or recording.

Attributes can be used to indicate a primary collector and a sequence number.

The first collector, which may be flagged by means of an attribute,is normally a single person in charge of the field book to which records are added or the team leader. It may be the person whose collection number is cited but it could be an organisation name if the collector is not known. Further collectors who were part of the team or other individuals who may have passed specimens or data onto the team can be cited as well.
documentation: A person or one of a group of persons, team(s), or organisations responsible for collecting or recording.
abcd3_doc: A concept to bundle contact information.
content:
A person or one of a group of persons, team(s), or organisations responsible for collecting or recording.

Attributes can be used to indicate a primary collector and a sequence number.

The first collector, which may be flagged by means of an attribute,is normally a single person in charge of the field book to which records are added or the team leader. It may be the person whose collection number is cited but it could be an organisation name if the collector is not known. Further collectors who were part of the team or other individuals who may have passed specimens or data onto the team can be cited as well.
schema_documentation: The person, or one of the persons or team(s) or organization(s) responsible for collecting or recording. Attributes: a flag indicating the primary collector, and a sequence number.

content: A language-specific label representation of the name of the organisation acting as or representing the gathering agent. The attribute @language lets you specify the language, the Representation mechanism makes it possible to ensure that only one name per language is specified.

Export_documentation: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute, according to RFC 3066.
usage_notes:
The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .
documentation: Language representation
content: The language of the element contained in the representation. This is a mandatory attribute. The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.
comment: wrongly documented in the TDWG Wiki as '/DataSets/DataSet/Units/Unit/Gathering/Agents/GatheringAgent/Organization/Name/Representation/@language' (Organisation with a z)
recommended:
XML type xs:language. According to [http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/], recommended values are defined by the following reference:
H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995.
Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt.

Export_documentation: Abbreviation representing the organisation acting as or associated with the gathering agent. For FAO/IPGRI multi-crop passport data (MCPD), this is the descriptor indicating the Institute collecting the sample (COLLCODE). If the holding institute has collected the material, this should be the same as the holding institute code (INSTCODE, in ABCD: SourceID). Restricted to 50 characters maximum length, including blanks (shorter recommended!). Label abbreviations are especially important when displaying information in a tabular format.
documentation: Label abbreviation representing the organisation acting as or associated with the gathering agent.
abcd3_doc: Label abbreviation representing an organisation.
content: Abbreviation representing the organisation acting as or associated with the gathering agent. For FAO/IPGRI multi-crop passport data (MCPD), this is the descriptor indicating the Institute collecting the sample (COLLCODE). If the holding institute has collected the material, this should be the same as the holding institute code (INSTCODE, in ABCD: SourceID). Restricted to 50 characters maximum length, including blanks (shorter recommended!). Label abbreviations are especially important when displaying information in a tabular format.
comment: wrongly documented in the TDWG Wiki and the Access Database as '/DataSets/DataSet/Units/Unit/Gathering/Agents/GatheringAgent/Organization/Name/Representation/Abbreviation' (Organisation with a z)
schema_documentation: Restricted to 50 characters maximum length, including blanks (recommended to be shorter!). Label abbreviations are especially important when displaying information in a tabular format.

The name may include titles. Preferred form of personal name for display as a string.

The name of person as normally used representing the gathering agent.

The name may include titles.

Export_documentation:
The full name of the gathering agent in a form appropriate for sorting alphabetically.

The form consists of the following: Family name first followed by a comma then a space then given names or initials separated by a space.
example_explanation:
Lastname, Firstname

Lastname, Firstname Middle-Initial
documentation: The full name of the gathering agent in a form appropriate for sorting alphabetically. (vCard: Sort-String)
abcd3_doc: The full name of a person in a form appropriate for sorting alphabetically.
documentation_corrected: The full name of the gathering agent in an appropriate form for alphabetical sorting. (vCard: Sort-String)
content:
The full name of the gathering agent in a form appropriate for sorting alphabetically.

The form consists of the following: Family name first followed by a comma then a space then given names or initials separated by a space.
content_corrected: The full name of the gathering agent in an appropriate form for alphabetical sorting. The form consists of the following: Family name first followed by a comma then a space then given names or initials separated by a space.
schema_documentation: The full name with the elements in preferred sorting sequence (vCard: Sort-String).

Export_documentation: Atomised name of the gathering agent.
documentation: Atomised name of the gathering agent.
content: Atomised name of the gathering agent.
schema_documentation: Atomised name of the person.

Export_documentation: The inherited name of the gathering agent. This may consist of family names, generational names, a clan name, parents or grandparents personal names, etc. The inherited name (this being the lastname in western cultures) may be compound (e.g. 'Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture, the inherited name is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to a married couple. Therefore, 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard (vCard: N-Family).
documentation: The inherited name of the gathering agent, which is the lastname in western cultures.
abcd3_doc: The inherited name of a person.
content: The inherited name of the gathering agent. This may consist of family names, generational names, a clan name, parents or grandparents personal names, etc. The inherited name (this being the lastname in western cultures) may be compound (e.g. 'Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture, the inherited name is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to a married couple. Therefore, 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard (vCard: N-Family).
schema_documentation: Family names, generational names, clan name, parents/grandparents personal names, etc. This (= last name in western cultures) may be compound ('Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture it is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to the married couple and children, thus 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard. (vCard:N.Family)

Export_documentation: The prefix to the gathering agent's inherited name. The prefix should be output before the name, but is usually not included in sorting. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard: N-Prefix)
documentation: The prefix to the gathering agent's inherited name.
abcd3_doc: The prefix to a persons inherited name.
content: The prefix to the gathering agent's inherited name. The prefix should be output before the name, but is usually not included in sorting. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard: N-Prefix)
schema_documentation: Prefix to inherited name that should be output before name, but is usually not included in sorting. Examples: 'von', 'Lord'. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard:N.Prefix)

Export_documentation: The suffix for the name of the gathering agent.  The suffix should be output after the name, regardless of whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not (vCard: N-Suffix).
documentation: The suffix for the name of the gathering agent.
abcd3_doc: The suffix for the name of a person.
content: The suffix for the name of the gathering agent.  The suffix should be output after the name, regardless of whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not (vCard: N-Suffix).
schema_documentation: Suffix to name that should be output after name, regardless whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not. Examples: 'Jun.', 'III.'. (vCard:N.Suffix)

Export_documentation: The personal name of the gathering agent. The name given to the person as a personal name (the first or christian name in western cultures, including middle initials). The given name may contain several words. It is applicable only to people (vCard: N-Given + vCard: N-Middle).
documentation: The personal name of the gathering agent, which is the first or christian name in western cultures.
abcd3_doc: The name of a person, which is the first or christian name in western cultures.
content: The personal name of the gathering agent. The name given to the person as a personal name (the first or christian name in western cultures, including middle initials). The given name may contain several words. It is applicable only to people (vCard: N-Given + vCard: N-Middle).
schema_documentation: The name given to a person as a personal name (= first or Christian name in western cultures, including 'middle initials') may contain several words ('Ana Maria', 'Jerry B.'). Applicable only to persons. (vCard:N.Given + vCard:N.Middle)

Export_documentation: The preferred name of the gathering agent. The preferred name may differ from the first given name (e.g. second given name, nickname ('Bob' for 'Robert'), etc.) (vCard: Nickname).
documentation: The preferred name of the gathering agent.
abcd3_doc: The preferred name of a person.
content: The preferred name of the gathering agent. The preferred name may differ from the first given name (e.g. second given name, nickname ('Bob' for 'Robert'), etc.) (vCard: Nickname).

The schema description for this element is a container element, but i did not notice that it contains 'unbounded' permits. Is this a repeatable container element??

yes, indeed, this is an error in the schema, will be corrected in v. 2.01

Export_documentation:
The original gathering locality data as appearing on a label or in an original entry, as a text string. This field should be transcribed verbatim from the specimen label.

Location information below the country level that describes where the accession was collected. This might include the distance in kilometres and direction from the nearest town, village or map grid reference point. A FAO/IPGRI multi-crop passport descriptor (MCPD), description and examples taken from EURISCO descriptor list dated July 3, 2002.

Where possible, the language of the label locality should be indicated with the language attribute.

Editorial omissions for brevity, etc. should be indicated with an ellipsis (...) and interpreted or implied text should be included in square brackets [ ].
Export_example:
New Caledonia, below summit region of Mt Mou.

New South Wales, Central Tablelands 12 km SW or Armidale.

7 km south of Curitiba in the state of Parana

Export_documentation:
Details about the gathering country, such as the representation of the country and its name. This is separate from {{{NamedArea}}} for compatibility reasons.

Maps to Darwin Core 2: Country through either {{{ISO2Letter}}} (future) or {{{CountryName}}} (current). Historical country names and water bodies outside the coastal zone can be entered under named area.

{{{CountryNameDerived}}} is provided for a country name that has been derived (e.g.from a system supplied dictionary) by library consultation or other independent research.

At least one of {{{CountryName}}} or {{{ISO2}}} or {{{ISO3}}} should be present but more are allowed. This should be the political country having jurisdiction over the collection site.
To Do: see editorial_notes; DwC?; ISO 2 / 3; links to other concepts
documentation: Elements covering the representation of the gathering country and its name.
abcd3_doc: Elements covering the representation of a country and its name.
content:
Details about the gathering country, such as the representation of the country and its name. This is separate from {{{NamedArea}}} for compatibility reasons.

Maps to Darwin Core 2: Country through either {{{ISO2Letter}}} (future) or {{{CountryName}}} (current). Historical country names and water bodies outside the coastal zone can be entered under named area.

{{{CountryNameDerived}}} is provided for a country name that has been derived (e.g.from a system supplied dictionary) by library consultation or other independent research.

At least one of {{{CountryName}}} or {{{ISO2}}} or {{{ISO3}}} should be present but more are allowed. This should be the political country having jurisdiction over the collection site.
editorial_notes: Country names and ISO codes can theoretically be part of controlled enumerations but if included within the schema would blow it out to an unacceptable level; is it possible to refer to these lists externally with physically invoking them? [JRC]
notes_total: Country names and ISO codes can theoretically be part of controlled enumerations but if included within the schema would blow it out to an unacceptable level; is it possible to refer to these lists externally with physically invoking them? [JRC]
schema_documentation: Details of the country. Separate from NamedArea for compatibility reasons.

Export_documentation:
The full name of the country or major region where the specimen was collected, or the observation made.

The use of this element is slightly ambiguous in that local practice might require either a verbatim quote from specimen labels, or standardisation by controlled vocabulary or lookup lists.

It is recommended that the spelling of the country be that which is recognised by the International Standards Organisation (ISO).

For cases where country names or boundaries have changed, it is recommended that new country names be enclosed in square brackets, after the old country name. The 2-letter ISO codes in the ISO Code for Country of Origin field assist with updating and cross referencing country names where boundaries change.

Separate fields for state/province and country are needed to adequately handle the situation with international collections.

If the name of the country where the plant was collected is unknown, then this field should contain the value 'UNKNOWN'. In this case, the ISO Code for Country of Origin field must have the entry 'XX' or 'XY'. All remaining 'location group' fields should be left unfilled.
Export_example:
Australia

Commonwealth of Australia

Iceland

Republic of Iceland

Samoa

Independent State of Samoa
documentation: The name of the country or major gathering region of a specimen or observation.
abcd3_doc: The name of the country or major region.

Separate fields for state/province and country are needed to adequately handle the situation with international collections.

If the name of the country where the plant was collected is unknown, then this field should contain the value 'UNKNOWN'. In this case, the ISO Code for Country of Origin field must have the entry 'XX' or 'XY'. All remaining 'location group' fields should be left unfilled.

Commonwealth of Australia

Republic of Iceland

Export_documentation:
The derived full name of the country or major region where the specimen was collected, or the observation made, interpreted in the light of contemporary geographical knowledge.

The use of this element is slightly ambiguous in that local practice might require either a verbatim quote from specimen labels, or standardisation by controlled vocabulary or lookup lists.

It is recommended that the spelling of the country should be that which is recognised by the International Standards Organisation (ISO).

The derived country name offers the opportunity to document the name under which a country is currently known, interpreted from an old or superceded name on the specimen label (e.g. Vanuatu for the New Hebrides, Sri Lanka for Ceylon, etc).

Separate fields for state/province and country are needed to adequately handle the situation with international collections.

If the name of the country where the plant was collected is unknown, then this field should contain the value 'UNKNOWN'. In this case, the ISO Code for Country of Origin field must have the entry 'XX', 'XY', 'XXX', or 'XXY'. All remaining 'location group' fields should be left unfilled.
documentation: The derived name of country or major region where the specimen was collected or the observation made.
abcd3_doc: The derived name of country or major region where a specimen was collected or an observation made.
content:
The derived full name of the country or major region where the specimen was collected, or the observation made, interpreted in the light of contemporary geographical knowledge.

The use of this element is slightly ambiguous in that local practice might require either a verbatim quote from specimen labels, or standardisation by controlled vocabulary or lookup lists.

It is recommended that the spelling of the country should be that which is recognised by the International Standards Organisation (ISO).

The derived country name offers the opportunity to document the name under which a country is currently known, interpreted from an old or superceded name on the specimen label (e.g. Vanuatu for the New Hebrides, Sri Lanka for Ceylon, etc).

Separate fields for state/province and country are needed to adequately handle the situation with international collections.

If the name of the country where the plant was collected is unknown, then this field should contain the value 'UNKNOWN'. In this case, the ISO Code for Country of Origin field must have the entry 'XX', 'XY', 'XXX', or 'XXY'. All remaining 'location group' fields should be left unfilled.
editorial_notes: This element is also covered by various geographic standards and may be better covered by reference to these. [JRC]
notes_total: This element is also covered by various geographic standards and may be better covered by reference to these. [JRC]

Export_documentation:
The 2-, 3-, or 4-letter code for the representation of the name of the gathering country using the codes assigned by the International Standards Organisation (ISO).

This field should contain a valid entry as defined by the International Standards Organisation (ISO Standard 3166-1), with the following exception: The 'XXX' or 'XX' code should be used when no country of origin information is provided. The 'XXY' or 'XY' code should be used for non-specific collecting localities, e.g. Africa, SouthEast Asia.
documentation: A 2- or 3-letter (ISO3166-1) or 4-letter (ISO3166-3) code for representation of the name of the country or origin.
abcd3_doc: A 2- or 3-letter (ISO3166-1) or 4-letter (ISO3166-3) code for representation of the name of the country or origin.
content:
The 2-, 3-, or 4-letter code for the representation of the name of the gathering country using the codes assigned by the International Standards Organisation (ISO).

This field should contain a valid entry as defined by the International Standards Organisation (ISO Standard 3166-1), with the following exception: The 'XXX' or 'XX' code should be used when no country of origin information is provided. The 'XXY' or 'XY' code should be used for non-specific collecting localities, e.g. Africa, SouthEast Asia.

Note: The letter code identifies a country name, NOT a physical territory. For the latter, there is a ISO 3166 numerical code. For exemple, when Germany reunified, it kept DE/DEU but changed from 280 to 276, while when Southern Rhodesia was renamed Zimbabwe it stayed 716 but changed from RH/RHO to ZW/ZWE.

See comments under Country.
editorial_notes: $$Walter$$ to follow this up (needs to add the ISO numerical code).
notes_total:
$$Walter$$ to follow this up (needs to add the ISO numerical code).;

See comments under Country.
schema_documentation: 2- or 3-letter (ISO3166-1) or 4-letter (ISO3166-3) code for representation of name of country or origin.

Export_documentation:
The longitude of the gathering site, expressed in decimal degrees.

Degrees (3 digits), minutes (2 digits), and seconds (2 digits) followed by E (East) or W (West). Every missing digit (minutes or seconds) should be indicated with a hyphen. Leading zeros are required.
To Do:
see editorial_notes; A FAO/IPGRI multi-crop passport descriptor (MCPD), description and examples taken from EURISCO descriptor list dated July 3, 2002.

Export_documentation: DwC Geospatial Extension v. 1.4: ] A measure of how well the circle defined by the coordinates and uncertainty match the original spatial representation, as a ratio of the area of the circle to the area of the original spatial representation. Legal values are 0, greater than or equal to 1, or undefined. A value of 1 is an exact match or 100% overlap. A value of 0 should be used if the given georeference does not completely contain the original representation. The PointRadiusSpatialFit is undefined if the original representation is a point without uncertainty and the given georeference is not that same point (without uncertainty). If both the original and the given georeference are the same point, the PointRadiusSpatialFit is 1. Detailed explanations with graphical examples can be found in the Guide to Best Practices for Georeferencing (Chapman and Wieczorek, eds. 2006).
abcd3_doc: DwC Geospatial Extension v. 1.4: ] A measure of how well the circle defined by the coordinates and uncertainty match the original spatial representation, as a ratio of the area of the circle to the area of the original spatial representation.
schema_documentation: [DwC Geospatial Extension v. 1.4: ] A measure of how well the circle defined by the coordinates and uncertainty match the original spatial representation, as a ratio of the area of the circle to the area of the original spatial representation. Legal values are 0, greater than or equal to 1, or undefined. A value of 1 is an exact match or 100% overlap. A value of 0 should be used if the given georeference does not completely contain the original representation. The PointRadiusSpatialFit is undefined if the original representation is a point without uncertainty and the given georeference is not that same point (without uncertainty). If both the original and the given georeference are the same point, the PointRadiusSpatialFit is 1. Detailed explanations with graphical examples can be found in the Guide to Best Practices for Georeferencing (Chapman and Wieczorek, eds. 2006).

Export_documentation: The altitude of the gathering site land or floor level, given as distance above (positive) or below mean sea level. Although the altitude could be covered by the generic element for site measurements, the separate altitude element is preserved for the sake of clarity.

content:
The altitude of the gathering site land or floor level, given as distance above (positive) or below mean sea level. (Note the difference from the {{{Height}}} and {{{Depth}}} elements, which are measured relative to a local surface.)

Although the altitude could be covered by the generic element for site measurements, the separate altitude element is preserved for the sake of clarity.
notes_total: Note the difference from the {{{Height}}} and {{{Depth}}} elements, which are measured relative to a local surface.

content: This is set to "Altitude" by definition for measurements of altitude.
editorial_notes:
Is the generic description for parameter I found in the schema ok for this element? Should I take out the examples like width, circumference etc.?

The parameter element makes sense only where the measurmentOrFact type is used to describe "open" measurements, where the users decide what it is what is measured. Altitude etc. are a special case, the parameter is actually always altitude. A solution to this would be to exclude this from the MoF and put it into an extension, only used when general measurements are asked for. I added this to the Schema discussion page. For the time being, the above (English?) can serve as a template for similar cases (depth etc.).
notes_total:

The parameter element makes sense only where the measurmentOrFact type is used to describe "open" measurements, where the users decide what it is what is measured. Altitude etc. are a special case, the parameter is actually always altitude. A solution to this would be to exclude this from the MoF and put it into an extension, only used when general measurements are asked for. I added this to the Schema discussion page. For the time being, the above (English?) can serve as a template for similar cases (depth etc.).

Export_documentation:
Vertical distance point or range measurement in relation to a ground datum (such as water level, or the level of the sea floor for benthic samples).

This depth should be positive below the surface and negative above (e.g. collecting above sea level in tidal areas).

Although the depth could be covered by a generic element for site measurements, the separate Depth element is preserved for the sake of clarity.

abcd3_doc: A quantitative or categorical measurement related to a unit.
content:
Vertical distance point or range measurement in relation to a ground datum (such as water level, or the level of the sea floor for benthic samples).

This depth should be positive below the surface and negative above (e.g. collecting above sea level in tidal areas).

Although the depth could be covered by a generic element for site measurements, the separate Depth element is preserved for the sake of clarity.

A container element for several elements expressing stratigraphy at the gathering site (geological dating and rock unit names related to the site or sample locations).

The structure allows for a full analysis of stratigraphy (e.g. to allow fossils in collections to be sorted by period and zone. Also allows for free text terms when their status is unknown or for more full descriptions of the stratigraphy of site).
documentation: A container element for several elements expressing stratigraphy at the gathering site.
content:
A container element for several elements expressing stratigraphy at the gathering site (geological dating and rock unit names related to the site or sample locations).

The structure allows for a full analysis of stratigraphy (e.g. to allow fossils in collections to be sorted by period and zone. Also allows for free text terms when their status is unknown or for more full descriptions of the stratigraphy of site).
schema_documentation: A container for geological dating and rock unit names related to the site or sample locations

Export_documentation: The relationship of the unit gathered with other taxa at the gathering site.
documentation: The relationship of the unit gathered with other taxa at the gathering site.
abcd3_doc: The relationship of the unit gathered with other taxa at the gathering site.
content:
The relationship of the unit gathered with other taxa at the gathering site.

Note that this relationship can be recorded as a feature of the location (e.g. a syntaxon, or certain species known to grow together at the site). It can also be used to record an observed relationship (e.g. caterpillar and observed food plant, parasite and host etc.), but this would be better expressed as a unit association.
notes_total: Note that this relationship can be recorded as a feature of the location (e.g. a syntaxon, or certain species known to grow together at the site). It can also be used to record an observed relationship (e.g. caterpillar and observed food plant, parasite and host etc.), but this would be better expressed as a unit association.
schema_documentation: Relationship of the unit gathered with other taxa at the gathering site

Export_documentation:
One of the following, representing the genus, or higher taxon name, that is part of the identification for the associated taxon for the unit.

A generic name as a botanical scientific name or as part of it.

A generic name under one of the established nomenclatural codes

A manuscript name

An intergeneric hybrid name under the ICBN, without the leading multiplication sign,

The name of an intergeneric graft hybrid or graft chimaera, published under the Cultivated Code.

Rules:

1. First letter capitalised.

2. No spaces included.
abcd3_doc: The genus as part or only result of an identification, or a higher taxon name representing that result.

Note that quadrinomials etc. are not supported here as names; if deemed necessary, they can be entered in the FullScientificNameString, this element should than contain the last infraspecific epithet.

Rules:

Export_documentation:
The facing direction (aspect) of the entire gathering site or a sample point.

This is measured in either letters (e.g. NE, SW) or Degrees (e.g. 270).

This information is of particular interest in relation to exposure and incident sunlight.

The values in these fields are nearly always directional and restricted to mountainous or sloping ground.
documentation: The facing direction (aspect) of the entire gathering site or a sample point.

The values in these fields are nearly always directional and restricted to mountainous or sloping ground.

Export_documentation:
The direction, orientation or aspect of the slope of the gathering site expressed in compass points.

The value 'Open' can be used to describe flat plains or exposed ridge crests; 'Closed' can be used for valleys or ravines.

Export_documentation: [DwC Geospacial Extension Schema v. 0.3]. A Well-Known Text (WKT; see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Well-known_text) representation of the the shape (footprint) that defines the location of the occurrence. Example: the one-degree box with opposite corners at (longitude=10, latitude=20) and (longitude=11, latitude=21) would be expressed in well-known text as POLYGON ((10 20, 11 20, 11 21, 10 21, 10 20))
abcd3_doc: [DwC Geospacial Extension Schema v. 0.3]. A Well-Known Text (WKT; see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Well-known_text) representation of the the shape (footprint) that defines the location of the occurrence.
schema_documentation: [DwC Geospacial Extension Schema v. 0.3]. A Well-Known Text (WKT; see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Well-known_text) representation of the the shape (footprint) that defines the location of the occurrence. Example: the one-degree box with opposite corners at (longitude=10, latitude=20) and (longitude=11, latitude=21) would be expressed in well-known text as POLYGON ((10 20, 11 20, 11 21, 10 21, 10 20))

Export_documentation: [DwC Geospacial Extension Schema v. 0.3] A measure of how well the geometry expressed in the footprint match the original spatial representation, as a ratio of the area of the footprint given to the area of the original spatial representation. Legal values are 0, greater than or equal to 1, or undefined. A value of 1 is an exact match or 100% overlap. A value of 0 should be used if the given georeference does not completely contain the original representation. The FootprintSpatialFit is undefined if the original representation is a point without uncertainty and the given georeference is not that same point (without uncertainty). If both the original and the given georeference are the same point, the FootprintSpatialFit is 1. Detailed explanations with graphical examples can be found in the Guide to Best Practices for Georeferencing (Chapman and Wieczorek, eds. 2006)
abcd3_doc: [DwC Geospacial Extension Schema v. 0.3] A measure of how well the geometry expressed in the footprint match the original spatial representation, as a ratio of the area of the footprint given to the area of the original spatial representation.
schema_documentation: [DwC Geospacial Extension Schema v. 0.3] A measure of how well the geometry expressed in the footprint match the original spatial representation, as a ratio of the area of the footprint given to the area of the original spatial representation. Legal values are 0, greater than or equal to 1, or undefined. A value of 1 is an exact match or 100% overlap. A value of 0 should be used if the given georeference does not completely contain the original representation. The FootprintSpatialFit is undefined if the original representation is a point without uncertainty and the given georeference is not that same point (without uncertainty). If both the original and the given georeference are the same point, the FootprintSpatialFit is 1. Detailed explanations with graphical examples can be found in the Guide to Best Practices for Georeferencing (Chapman and Wieczorek, eds. 2006)

Export_documentation:
The original number assigned to the unit by the collector or observer. The entire desiganation is normally composed of the name or initials of the collector(s) followed by a number. This number is essential for identifying duplicates held in different collections.

This identifier should be added to the entry (for collectors) under {{{Gathering/GatheringAgents/../Person}}}, if such an entry exists. However, the collector (or collector abbreviation) and number can also be given in a single field (e.g. FAO/IPGRI multi-crop passport descriptor (MCPD), described in the EURISCO descriptor list dated July 3, 2002). In that case, the entire string may be entered here.
To Do: eleminate braces; A FAO/IPGRI multi-crop passport descriptor (MCPD), description and examples taken from EURISCO descriptor list dated July 3, 2002

However, the collector (or collector abbreviation) and number can also be given in a single field (e.g. FAO/IPGRI multi-crop passport descriptor (MCPD), described in the EURISCO descriptor list dated July 3, 2002). Export_documentation:
The sex of the entire unit, which may be mixed ((Male, Female, Unknown, Not applicable (e.g. for a fungus in a herbarium), MiXed).

Darwin Core 2: Sex.

Examples of content found by Charles Hussey in NHM databases include the following entries: [Female; Female (5); Female(2); Male; Male (2) Female (1); 1 brooding female; 1 Male; 1 Male and 1 Female; 15 Females and 3 Males; 16 Females and 23 Males; 2 female + 1 male; 2 Females; 2 females, 1 male; 3 females, 3 males; 5 Females; 7 Females and 5 Males; Both sexes; Ephippial female; Ephypial female;]
To Do: see editorial_notes; DwC?; revise documentation; add explanation of enumeration (M, F, U, N, X)
documentation: The sex of an the organism (Male, Female, Unknown, Not applicable (e.g. for a fungus in a herbarium), MiXed).
abcd3_doc: The sex of an the organism (Male, Female, Unknown, Not applicable (e.g. for a fungus in a herbarium), MiXed).
content:
The sex of the entire unit, which may be mixed ((Male, Female, Unknown, Not applicable (e.g. for a fungus in a herbarium), MiXed). Note that counts can be provided in the Unit's {{{MeasurementsOrFacts}}} section.

Darwin Core 2: Sex.

Examples of content found by Charles Hussey in NHM databases include the following entries: [Female; Female (5); Female(2); Male; Male (2) Female (1); 1 brooding female; 1 Male; 1 Male and 1 Female; 15 Females and 3 Males; 16 Females and 23 Males; 2 female + 1 male; 2 Females; 2 females, 1 male; 3 females, 3 males; 5 Females; 7 Females and 5 Males; Both sexes; Ephippial female; Ephypial female;]
editorial_notes: This is another element in need of a standard term list enforced on the database level.
notes_total: This is another element in need of a standard term list enforced on the database level.; Note that counts can be provided in the Unit's {{{MeasurementsOrFacts}}} section.
schema_documentation: Maps to Darwin Core 2: Sex. Refers to the entire unit, which may be mixed. Note that counts can be provided in the Unit's MeasurementsOrFacts section.
restriction_detail: ( enumeration=( M, F, U, N, X, ))

Export_documentation: The inherited name of the unit sequencing agent. This may consist of family names, generational names, a clan name, parents or grandparents personal names, etc. The inherited name (this being the lastname in western cultures) may be compound (e.g. 'Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture, the inherited name is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to a married couple. Therefore, 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard (vCard: N-Family).
documentation: The inherited name of the unit sequencing agent, which is the lastname in western cultures.
abcd3_doc: The inherited name of a person.
content: The inherited name of the unit sequencing agent. This may consist of family names, generational names, a clan name, parents or grandparents personal names, etc. The inherited name (this being the lastname in western cultures) may be compound (e.g. 'Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture, the inherited name is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to a married couple. Therefore, 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard (vCard: N-Family).
schema_documentation: Family names, generational names, clan name, parents/grandparents personal names, etc. This (= last name in western cultures) may be compound ('Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture it is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to the married couple and children, thus 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard. (vCard:N.Family)

Export_documentation: The prefix to the inherited name of the unit sequencing agent. The prefix should be output before the name, but is usually not included in sorting. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard: N-Prefix)

abcd3_doc: The prefix to a persons inherited name.
content: The prefix to the inherited name of the unit sequencing agent. The prefix should be output before the name, but is usually not included in sorting. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard: N-Prefix)
schema_documentation: Prefix to inherited name that should be output before name, but is usually not included in sorting. Examples: 'von', 'Lord'. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard:N.Prefix)

Export_documentation: The suffix for the name of the unit sequencing agent. The suffix should be output after the name, regardless of whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not (vCard: N-Suffix).

abcd3_doc: The suffix for the name of a person.
content: The suffix for the name of the unit sequencing agent. The suffix should be output after the name, regardless of whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not (vCard: N-Suffix).
schema_documentation: Suffix to name that should be output after name, regardless whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not. Examples: 'Jun.', 'III.'. (vCard:N.Suffix)

Export_documentation: The personal name of the unit sequencing agent. The name given to the person as a personal name (the first or christian name in western cultures, including middle initials). The given name may contain several words. It is applicable only to people (vCard: N-Given + vCard: N-Middle).
documentation: The personal name of the unit sequencing agent, which is the first or christian name in western cultures.
abcd3_doc: The name of a person, which is the first or christian name in western cultures.
content: The personal name of the unit sequencing agent. The name given to the person as a personal name (the first or christian name in western cultures, including middle initials). The given name may contain several words. It is applicable only to people (vCard: N-Given + vCard: N-Middle).
schema_documentation: The name given to a person as a personal name (= first or Christian name in western cultures, including 'middle initials') may contain several words ('Ana Maria', 'Jerry B.'). Applicable only to persons. (vCard:N.Given + vCard:N.Middle)

Export_documentation: The preferred name of the unit sequencing agent. The preferred name may differ from the first given name (e.g. second given name, nickname ('Bob' for 'Robert'), etc.) (vCard: Nickname).

Title for the role of the person or organisation acting as or representing the unit sequencing agent. This element can be used to provide a title such as "Database Administrator" or "Curator" when no individual person is named.

Export_documentation:
The extension is temporary and serves only to accommodate urgent inter-version additions to the unit-object schema [in the future to the the various schemas/objects used in ABCD].

For example, if a specific community (e.g. culture collections) discover that there are elements missing in the current version of ABCD (as they did for 1.2), they communicate that to the group responsible for schema development, who will discuss whether these elements are already accommodated in the schema, if they are not and if they can and should be generalized, and where they should end up in the schema. IF the culture collection community needs to move rapidly (e.g. due to project pressures), they can add these elements to the current version as an extension schema under a structure that follows SDD's CustomExtensions element (CustomExtensions-CustomExtension-Any ##other). In future modular versions of ABCD, such a structure should exist in the root of every object/schema.
documentation: The extension is temporary and serves only to accommodate urgent inter-version additions to the unit-object schema [in the future to the the various schemas/objects used in ABCD].
content:
The extension is temporary and serves only to accommodate urgent inter-version additions to the unit-object schema [in the future to the the various schemas/objects used in ABCD].

For example, if a specific community (e.g. culture collections) discover that there are elements missing in the current version of ABCD (as they did for 1.2), they communicate that to the group responsible for schema development, who will discuss whether these elements are already accommodated in the schema, if they are not and if they can and should be generalized, and where they should end up in the schema. IF the culture collection community needs to move rapidly (e.g. due to project pressures), they can add these elements to the current version as an extension schema under a structure that follows SDD's CustomExtensions element (CustomExtensions-CustomExtension-Any ##other). In future modular versions of ABCD, such a structure should exist in the root of every object/schema.
schema_documentation: A container element to allow extensions to add additional data to the unit.
